all_reviews.review_title: Decent offering albeit slightly faulty
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dotdigital?
All the data is in one place and acts very well as a CRM. For us, it was a cost-effective solution to our previously siloed CRM set-up. The email builder is good; automation builder is excellent.

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
We had a few integration problems which were a headache to fix. We have also had issues here and there, which we had to point out before DotDigital could identify and fix them. Perhaps a bit of a problem with quality control?

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
We had a very cobbled-together solution for our CRM system. We used Mailchimp, Segmentation software, Zapier, Mandrill to offer a semi-sophisticated customer communication and management tool. Dot Digital put all of these under one service and did what we needed it to do.

all_reviews.review_title: Great for internal communications
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dotdigital?
Our regular communications to staff and volunteers have greatly improved since moving to DotDigital. The emails are much better looking, it's easier to send engaging content and makes it easy to measure engagement rates and adjust comms based on the data.

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
We have so many different audiences that it would be great to have better reporting functionality by tags rather than across all emails, and to also have analysis on the data fields we input to tailor emails too.

E.g. I sometimes upload the sites where staff work to use with dynamic content blocks, so Kent staff will only get information related to the Kent site for example, but would also be great to be able to see of all staff who opened my emails which are from each of the sites.

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
Reporting on engagement and delivering personalised dynamic content to users.

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
Sometimes the system seems to behave in ways I don't expect - for example I have found in the past that contacts I have excluded from one particular segment seem to be excluded from all segments and address books, but the system does not flag this, meaning my communications don't reach all intended recipients, impacting performance

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
Dot digital allows me to quickly produce efficient and effective email communications, and to personalize recipients based on previous user behaviour. The automation tools also reduce the amount of manual work required.

What do you like best about Dotdigital?
DotDigtial is a very intuitive to use platform which can be used by non-communications experts with ease. There is rich functionality and the customer support is excellent.

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
There are some features missing from DotDigital when it comes to reporting, segmenting, restricting usage / permissions and a few other items which would make the life of an admin much easier. However, there is a roadmap which you can contribute to so your ideas are often heard.

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
DotDigital is allowing our Customer Success Managers to independently interact with their customers without relying on marketing support to facilitate. Enabling reporting on open and read rates it means there is enough basic functionality to keep our audiences and colleagues happy.

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
There are some limitations to the programs which can make it difficult to define actions based on contacts enrolment in other programs. The ability to do this would make life a little easier.

It helps us to deliver automated email nurture comms to prospective customers. By utilising automation rules it enables us to add or remove contacts at various stages dependent on their interaction with the business or the emails themselves.

all_reviews.review_title: Intuitive and innovative
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dotdigital?
It's user-friendly and easy to make nicely designed emails, so I can train colleagues and not worry about them getting stuck. It also has a lot of features we can use to really personalise our communications, which is great.

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
There are small glitches, such as when I make the text of a button bold and white against a colour, I'll save it and come back and it's changed it to a smaller font, black and not bold. This happens frequently, and whilst it's just a small bug, it can be annoying as you have to triple-check it hasn't happened again as black font on a purple button isn't readable.

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
We are able to hyper-personalise and automate our communications to reach supporters at key times with beneficial information that helps them and also us as an organisation.

all_reviews.review_title: The best user friendly customer engagement platform

What do you like best about Dotdigital?
Easy to use templates and highly supportive customer service is a deadly combination. The customer service has always been very quick to respond and resolve the problems. They are also very helpful in suggesting different ways to create effective campaigns. The platform itself has alot to offer and i am still in the learning process. From audience segmentation to uniqure personalisation, there is alot we can do with dot digital.  The new add-on function of Analytics is helpful in finding ways to optimise our campaigns effectively.

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
I find the platform designed more for retail business oriented. It will be great to have more functionality, webinars and event for B2B customers. It will be great to know how other B2B businesses are benefiting from dot digital and which elements works the best for them

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
As a CRM executive, Dot digital helps me automate campaigns effectively with provided personalisation. Easy to build templates and API connectivity with our in house CDP is great.

all_reviews.review_title: Solid, all-round comms platform, particularly good for the less-technical user
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dotdigital?
The jewel in the crown is probably EasyEditor, the WYSIWYG mail editor. Users can edit campaigns very simply; a  technical lead can set up templates, for others to edit text, images and layout tweaks without going deep into the code. I have about 35 users across my organisation, with varying skill levels, so this is a really useful tool.  It's quick to train them up and easy to troubleshoot if they have any problems. Automation in the platform is fairly extensive and improving year by year.

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
No major downsides! There are a few GUI gripes - it's not always easy to organise campaigns and images.  It's also a very retail-focused platform, so if you're not working in retail, some of the features will be fairly redundant.

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
The levels of personalisation and dynamic content allow us to send more targeted and relevant contacts to our audiences, and automation lets us do it at the right time too. We can also use automation to A/B test individual campaigns or entire user journeys. It's been a huge improvement over our previous setup.

all_reviews.review_title: Best service and ESP that I have used in 10 years
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dotdigital?
- Extremely helpful
- They have a high knowledge of e-mail marketing
- Very well-functioning backend, both for real tech nerds and noobs.
- Friendly interface and good help centers to set everything up yourself.
- Excellent reports
- Very good for scheduling emails
- Very good for building automation emails, both for the tech nerd and noobs
- Very easy to work in if you have multiple languages
- Perfect integration with Magento (the best I've ever seen without custom development)
- Time to market was less than a week for us

I have been working in e-commerce for more than 10 years and have never been so satisfied as know and I have tried all providers from Mailchimp, Active campaign, Klaviyo etc.

We are extremely satisfied already with DD and we still have to start with the automations. The current campaigns are just highly effective, good open rates, more than 99% deliverability rate and to be honest until now you guys have been one of the few companies that have kept their word of what they can really offer, so cheers to that and thank you again for your assistance!

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
- There are some add-ons you need to buy; however, they are one-off fees for multiple sending domains for example.

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
- Native integration with Magento to be able to build any automation based on any attribute you have in Magento
- Capturing guest carts for ab cart
- Insights on what my customers do and email them based on their behavior
- Send campaigns that are highly personalized
- Good deliverability 99% and up.
- Perfectly designed & delivered transactional emails

all_reviews.review_title: Good platform but some niggles around pricing and set-up
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dotdigital?
The platform itself is solid and well featured, with good deliverability, personalisation and scheduling options, management of contacts, segmentation, reporting, A/B testing and automation, SMS and web chat integration. Emails based on the paid-for template format well across all devices and clients with excellent consistency.

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
Pricing is a niggle, as the number of live contacts at a basic paid account level is not as generous as most competitors.
Testing on a range of clients and devices is chargeable for each send and the monthly fees are also steep compared to the competition.
Additional functionality such as Web Insights is available in most plans, but you have to set it up yourself, it is not included as part of the on-boarding process.

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
Overall the dotdigital platform is a reliable tool for email and SMS marketing. I have used it on e-commerce and lead generation sites and it performs well on both.

review_question_answers.question: What do you like best about Dotdigital?
review_question_answers.answer: The platform itself is solid and well featured, with good deliverability, personalisation and scheduling options, management of contacts, segmentation, reporting, A/B testing and automation, SMS and web chat integration. Emails based on the paid-for template format well across all devices and clients with excellent consistency.

Pricing is a niggle, as the number of live contacts at a basic paid account level is not as generous as most competitors.

Additional functionality such as Web Insights is available in most plans, but you have to set it up yourself, it is not included as part of the on-boarding process.

I was completely blown away with the level of customer service through the chat function on the website. Great that it is actually a real person that you speak to! I came to DotDigtial from another platform so I had to hit the ground running with my learning - they were helpful every step of the way often going above and beyond to help. Hannah, our Customer Success Manager has been awesome too - coming over to our location to fully understand the business and give her input on what she thought were the best steps going forward. Hannah has been such a support and honestly (as cheesy as it sounds) I don't think I would have got so far, so quickly without her!

DotDigital is an intuitive and user-friendly platform that is perfectly useable by staff without significant technical experience. It strikes a good balance of having a range of features but is not overwhelmingly complicated for organisations that need mostly standard functionality. Account management has been very responsive.

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
DotDigital proactively reached out when our sender reputation took a small dip and helped set us on course to identify what had caused it, a relatively minor issue but I was impressed that the DD team had clocked it.

all_reviews.review_title: Easy to Use Mass Marketing Solution
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dotdigital?
Dot Digital makes creating email campaigns and even online feedback forms a breeze, with it's simple yet effective WYSIWYG editors. There is also the option to do as many test sends as you like to ensure that things look just the way you want them before pinging it out to the masses.

There is also a handy, easy to interpret stats suite, which will show you at a glance how many emails in your campaign were delivered, how many readers clicked links and so on, allowing you to analyse what worked well and what didn't so you can plan future campaigns more effectively.

The account managers are friendly and will go above and beyond to get any issues you may have ironed out too!

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
Although effective, I think the contacts features of the system could be made a little bit easier to manage.

The only real issue we had with the system (and it was probably down to how we used it rather than a fault with Dot Digital itself) was that we used it to send out marketing emails AND occasionally regulatory emails. If people had unsubscribed from any of our marketing emails at any time, it then meant they didn't get the regulatory ones. Likewise if they had unsubscribed from a newsletter from one part of the business, this blanked unsubscribed them from everything we sent from DD.

This is a positive from a compliance perspective as it ensured we never sent anything to someone we shouldn't, and the system did output a list of addresses that had unsubscribed previously so we could deal with any regulatory emails to them separately.

One other really small thing, Dot Digital doesn't handle attachments to responses and just removes them, so it's important to set up a reply-to address on all campaigns so they are picked up!

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
Dot Digital made it easy for us to manage and send all of our campaigns from one place, and make them look attractive and easy to read at the same time.

Furthermore if we ever needed to garner feedback from our subscribers, it was quick and easy to create a form, and inspect the responses.

all_reviews.review_title: Good platform, stellar service
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dotdigital?
DotDigital's support is second to none. Most tools have unattended live chat, some of whom never even email you back. A much smaller number have people online when you're working. And fewer still have experts actually answering your chat questions, replying within seconds of you submitting your query. Consistently the best support service I have experienced from a B2B company - we're talking First Direct levels of customer service here. Stellar.

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
Email template builder is a little clunky and limited, and the decision to bury email reporting in their Analytics section is mystifying (I understand it would have been done to get more of us to look at their other analytics, but it's too tough to find).

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
DotDigital is a great solution for businesses looking to communicate with their customers and prospects. The powerful segmentation and automation options means DotDigital has a lot of power under the hood.

It's a straightforward system to navigate and use, which is marketing friendly, i.e you don't need to know any coding to use! I have now used Dotdigital at two companies and it's always been very smooth jumping into a new account and finding your way around. Our Customer Success Manager is brilliant; it feels like he genuinely wants to help us and always has plenty of ideas and knowledge to share.

We've recently invested in a new Gold Template and I've been so impressed with the process. The communication has been fantastic but most importantly, the initial design was so good we didn't require any amends!

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
The look and feel/user experience isn't as nicely designed as other systems. For me, the analytics area is not as strong compared to other systems in terms of what it offers but also the layout of the analysis pages.

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
Improving the design of our marketing emails and ensuring they're mobile-first. Our branding will be much stronger and more aligned to other marketing activities.

Reviewing our current Automation programmes so we can trust the set-up and segmentation, which previous colleagues did.

all_reviews.review_title: DotDigitial enables businesses to redefine their customer management
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dotdigital?
The integration with DotDigital and Dynamics allows us to create brilliant data-led campaigns and manage our communities better than ever before.

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
The data and analysis is severely lacking. For example, we use DD throughout the entire email campaign and registration process for our events through forms. Despite this, there is no source information, completion funnels or additional analysis offered. No customer journey analysis. The data is there! Why can't teams access it.

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
Allowing our CRM to power our marketing. Through the integrations we have, our CRM is no longer a database the team have to log into, it is now where the team live. Without DotDigital, we wouldn't be able to have this mindset.

all_reviews.review_title: Easy to customise, configure and utilise
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dotdigital?
DD's ability to quickly create responsive emails is a big step-up for us since we moved from Mailchimp. Now we can finally reach our design goals without having to compromise the look and feel of our brand for a responsive friendly middle ground. I would also like to mention that the support is fantastic, the best I have come across.

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
The user interface could be significantly improved. It looks somewhat dated and is often difficult to navigate. Modernise the user interface and experience and rule the market.

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
Managing our outbound marketing database allows us to segment and organise our data. Enabling us to contact customers with the information they want. The easy-to-configure API has also made Dot Digital the main database for our product registration system.

all_reviews.review_title: DotDigital - CameLife review
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dotdigital?
The platform is easy to use and has excellent product support both technical and success management. We picked DotDigital because they have local support here in Australia; at the time, no others did.  I find the canvas for designing automated campaigns very easy to use because it allows so much flexibility. The campaign templates are easy to edit.

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
DotDigital has fewer direct integrations than some of its competitors. Sure, there's usually an API workaround or I can use Zapier, but it would be nice to have direct integrations.

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
DotDigital is our primary means of communicating with our client base. We use automations to recover abandoned carts and browse sessions and for product campaigns.  We also do a monthly newsletter to our client base.

all_reviews.review_title: DotDigital have been amazing in assisting with us in two re brand projects
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dotdigital?
One of the best things about DotDigital is that they will go above and beyond to ensure your issues, questions and projects are met. They also provide a great support network for instances where out-of-office hours work is required. During our re-brands, they were very useful in sharing their expertise and helping us explore different options. All of their team are very friendly and easy to get on with.

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
I guess one of the downsides is that the only form of communication is via email or phone. I think it would be really helpful to have a slack workspace set up so that we can instant message our contact at DotDigital a bit easier.

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
The platform has helped solve our Automation worries. At our previous ESP, there wasn't any feature that allowed you to set up a program or triggered emails. This was a big pain point for us as we wanted to try and minimise as much manual send as possible.

all_reviews.review_title: Great technical advice but not consistent from all advisors
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dotdigital?
The customer / technical advisors are very quick in coming back to you about any problems on the platform. Some are more technical than others and carry out testing straight away for you without making this into a ticket. However, some of the tickets are followed up very quickly. Also a customer advisor was able to create a template f the automated program for me which really helped me get through completing the campaign.

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
Each technical advisor will offer different advice about the same issue and some will not resolve the issue at all or as well as others. Some have not emailed the chat history and I find it would help so that it can be used to reference back. There aren't any major issues overall.

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
The automated programs were a struggle to build and one of the technical advisors had suggested adding a triggered campaign in the properties section under the address book which really helped find the right solution to my problem. Then I could enrol the addressee into the program within properties also.

I have recently started using Dot Digital in my new role at Newcross Healthcare, and my initial feelings are its an easy-to-use and navigate system.
Also my Customer Sucess Manager - Sean Ardley has been on hand to point my in the right direction for help and support (the support member Max Benitez was fantastic)

review_question_answers.question: What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
review_question_answers.answer: Currently I haven't come across anything in particular - that makes me dislike anything

review_question_answers.question: What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
review_question_answers.answer: Easy to build and send communications

all_reviews.review_title: Excellent email automation platform
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dotdigital?
Ease of use and range of options for automation.
Customer service is prompt and helpful.

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
Having to log in repeatedly after what seems a very short time out!

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
Allows us to send triggered campaigns to lots of different audience segments. We are only a small business and love how this has enabled us to target our customers better.

all_reviews.review_title: An incredibly user-friendly platform
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dotdigital?
Dotdigital is really easy to use, while still having all of the powerful back-end tools that you need. I've used three ESPs now and Dotdigital is by far my favourite.

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
There is a limit on the number of API calls that you can make, which makes some of our processes more complicated. However, that is more to do with the way that we integrate with the platform.

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
Dotdigital allows us to email our subscribers in a timely and efficient manner. The ease with which emails can be built and scheduled frees up the team's time and allows us to work on other projects.

Much better experience than expected and I do not feel I was oversold anything.

all_reviews.review_title: A solid platform with some really nice features
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dotdigital?
The training and onboarding support is very good and the platform itself has some very interesting featutres.

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
There is a lack of cross account synching  and an inability to migrate (automations, templates, etc) from sandbox to the main account. There should be an abstracted database to hold all user details outside of the sender accounts.

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
The ability to set personliased content is key for us, in addition the ability to add in dynamic (external) and integrate our other solutions.

all_reviews.review_content:

Dotdigital has updated the facebook and google retargeting to allow you to remove contacts within a decision node

all_reviews.review_title: Intuitive platform but mass and segmented reporting could be better
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dotdigital?
I like the intuitive portal which allows multiple staff to easily and quickly create email camapaigns. The easy drag and drop builder is a particularly useful feature, as well as the stages of creating a camapign.

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
The reporting could be a little easier to access from the main homepage, and provide some extra elements like graphs and charts to easily see trends. This 'at a glance' review would be beneficial when generating reports.

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
It is our only email marketing solution, allowing us to deliver great comms to our audience. The simplicity of the platform allows multiple staff to easily pick up work without extensive training.

all_reviews.review_title: Market-leading product
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dotdigital?
Dotdigital is a great product for digital marketing teams, helping them segment, market and understand their audiences better and exceed lead generation targets. The account management is exceptionally responsive, while the technical support is accomplished, responsive and always dealt with by a friendly human rather than being pointed to a generic help doc that doesn't answer the query.

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
The product has become a little bit pricey to reflect its repositioning as an omnichannel marketing platform and CDP rather than what was historically an email service provider.

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
Dotdigital helps us segment our audience databases in an intuitive and comprehensive way, allowing us to better target our clients and provide more relevant marketing.

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
Honestly, there aren't many things I dislike, I would say I wish I had more control of the email designs.

Recommendations to others considering Dotdigital:
I would highly recommend it, having used MailChimp in the past, this is a complete level up

The problems we are solving are reaching our targets of people applying for the jobs we advertise in our campaigns.

all_reviews.review_title: High Level ESP - Account Management Makes The Difference
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dotdigital?
Easy to use- The ESP is simple enough to train new members of staff but allows for complexity to deliver on complicated customer journeys. Email builder is top notch and account management is great.

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
Cost structure is different vs other esp's used ( Pay per contact & limited api calls). Also the SMS functionality and reporting on the platform are pretty basic vs other ESPS.

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
Connecting with our customers on the right channel, with the right message at the right time- creating a holistic view of customers and delivering on key business revenue targets

all_reviews.review_title: Fantastic experience using Dot Digital
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dotdigital?
The most helpful thing about Dot Digital is the live chat element. I always find that this does help fill any gaps of knowledge that I have. Also discussing with our account manager Tom is very helpful with advice on how to further improve our emails and strategy.

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
I think there are some things that I would improve, such as adding remails as an option after a campaign has been scheduled/sent with more availability to choose the exact time that you want to send it on.

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
Our account manager is helping a lot with my gaps in knowledge, sending over fantastic resources and helpful webinars and workshops. This has helped in creating our first automated campaign.

all_reviews.review_title: Great platform with lots of cool features
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dotdigital?
Email, SMS, pages and forms and the customer analytics all in one place. really handy to keep everything together. Also has a pretty seamless integration with magento1/2

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
No auto responder for transactional emails, for me this should be a given because transactional email will always take place. Can be a little un-user friendly sometimes in it's layout and structure. Analytics and reporting has been unreliable in the past so it can be difficult to trust the data

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
Campaign emails, allows us to reach customers with marketing campaigns for new products, discount codes and sales. Automated emails - great for setting up campaigns and segments to run in the background, generating revenue and keeping customers engaged.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dotdigital?
I like the ability to copy campaigns and create templates. It makes creating a campaign a much quicker process, and allows me to follow the format we have created easily.

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
Sometimes formatting can be slightly odd. I think the whole media section needs updating. After importing an image, I often find it hard to locate it in the left panel.

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
We had an issue with accounts logging out and losing work in the past, but that had been resolved. There was also a bug with DotDigital not working on Apple Safari, but the dev team quickly fixed the issue! Great customer service!

all_reviews.review_title: Quick Review
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dotdigital?
How easy it is to create an email that you can send out to the masses. Segments are good and the analytics are very helpful. Overall really easy programme to use.

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
Adding contacts can be weird/sometimes can be glitchy when searching for a contact and it says they can't be found but when trying to add them, it says the email address is already in the address book. Bit weird.

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
Sending out emails to our company supporters and potential supporters is helping us generate warm leads by being able to see who opens and clicks on the links as well as being able to export these contacts super easily with no hassle.

all_reviews.review_content:

As basic users of Dotdigital, it's straightforward to create campaigns (once templates are setup), new address books and segments. The analytics has also been helpful.

As with any email marketing platform, Dotdigital has it's limitations - but none that impact too negatively on overall experience. We use the pages and forms function a lot, which isn't the most straightforward, and usability doesn't compare with purpose-built systems like SurveyMonkey. You can't copy segments, which would be a huge time saver for us.

We use Dotdigital mostly for email marketing, and the pages and forms function.

all_reviews.review_title: Flexible and with Good Support
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dotdigital?
The Dot Digital WYSIWYG is one of the most flexible I've worked with in my 8+ years in email marketing. The ability to easily combine drag-and-drop features, save custom blocks, and customize the underlying code is an excellent mixture of capabilities that helps us maximize efficiency without compromising quality or creativity customization.

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
There are a few minor pain points and limitations in reporting. The inability to export subject line or ISP complaints requires manual pulling by each campaign when needed. Results from variable tests are also reported only as a percentage of chosen KPI (opens, clicks, etc.). There's no ability to see hard numbers from the tests or other metrics to determine the statistical significance or unintended results (maybe opens increased per the test, but we saw clicks or conversions were lower). Automation reporting, when resending the same campaign multiple times (for example, a triggered offer based on set criteria), we are also unable to pull by send - it lumps all sends in as a single report.

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
The move to DotDigital pre-dated my current role, but we have realized an increased level of support and responsiveness. We also find that the flexibility in creating the creative/HTML of the emails is much more efficient than other enterprise-level systems.

Automation reporting, when resending the same campaign multiple times (for example, a triggered offer based on set criteria), we are also unable to pull by send - it lumps all sends in as a single report.

all_reviews.review_title: Really useful system for creating and sending mailing campaigns
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dotdigital?
The system allows you to create beautiful campaigns, with a high level of configurable options such as hiding sections for mobile. This allows you to really create a fantastic user-friendly mailer. The analytics are really useful, especially the ability to filter out non-human interactions so you can get a true picture of what your readers like. The split testing functionality is really useful and is easy to adapt to your needs. We also use the pages function which is really useful for completing bespoke landing pages for big campaigns on our website. We are just getting into the transactional emails feature but we are sure this will be as useful as the other features we use. If you have an issue with dotdigital, the online chat function is excellent with a member of the team usually available to help you within seconds.

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
The image manager is the only issue I've had - as we have many different newsletters, we have lots of folders which we've created through the years. It can be difficult to find the images you want, as you can easily search by name in Image manager but you can't select the image from that screen, you have to go back through the folders to find your image again, which can be tricky especially as we have many folders with similar names (which is admittedly our fault!)

Recommendations to others considering Dotdigital:
It's really easy to get the hang of and is very intuitive.

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
Our website allows us to send automated transactional emails, or messages to our users. However these do not look particularly professional. We now use Dotdigital to send messages to our members and can ensure we have a professional and consistent look to these.

The account management teams and support teams are always on hand to help. great teams to work with and help you with all aspects of campaign, strategy and dev.

Great for internal and external communications, automated supporter journeys and service emails

all_reviews.review_title: Be prepared for a 12/24 month contract that will handcuff your business.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dotdigital?
The platform is easy to use for simple email marketing. Setting up Programs (Automations that are triggered by actions) are easy as well if you have a little technical understanding.

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
I dislike the total lack of account management entirely. We've gone months without hearing from our account manager. We've called, sent emails, and have gone to the support tab on their website and still waited months for a reply. If you're a small or medium-sized business, go with another platform that will valve your business.

Recommendations to others considering Dotdigital:
Be prepared for a 12/24 month contract that will handcuff your business.

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
We can send basic marketing emails. We cannot send product recommendations, cart abandonments, transactional, or product follow-up emails. We've realized that we are not maximizing our ROI with DotDigital. While marketing on this platform, we only utilize 60% of our potential reach.

all_reviews.review_title: Good email marketing platform, intuitive and easy to use
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dotdigital?
Overal GUI of platform is intuitive and straightforward.  Onboarding was relatively easy.  Program builder for triggered email is easy to use.  Good API.  Support has been quick and helpful whenever needed.  Very, very, little downtime.  Segmentation tool is great!

Price is very competitive for featured offers and number of subscribers.  Platform is often updated with new features.

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
Email results reporting could be improved.  Had trouble setting up google analytics integration.  Lacking detailed metrics for transactional emails.

I wish the popup tool and survey functions were more versatile.

Recommendations to others considering Dotdigital:
Determine which features you really need in a platform.  Dotdigital gave us 90% of the features we needed at around half the cost of many competitors.

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
Campaign, triggered, and transactional email campaigns.
Capturing new email adresses.
Abandoned Cart emails

Revenue from email sales have increased significantly since using dotdigital.

all_reviews.review_title: Priscylla R. Over at Dot Digital is Awesome!
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dotdigital?
The DD platform is great on Magento 2. The integration is really good.  We had issues with our assigned representatives when we started over at DD. We lost a couple of them and we had issues with our account I was trying to get resolved. Then we were assigned Priscylla and she helped us fix a lot! I explained all the issues we had trying to set up additional more complicated campaigns. I mentioned some of the problems we had with our account I had been trying to get resolved to no avail. Priscylla understood my concerns and immediately started to address them. She got the right people involved and we started to work through each issue one at a time until they were all fixed.

DD is a very robust platform. They have tons of segmentation tools that can help you market and sell. The automation are outstanding also.

Also, the support team over at DD is amazing. Some of the best I have ever worked with. Very responsive and will help you get what you need to be resolved.

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
When we first started with DD we had a bit of a rough go. We were given a representative that quit the first 3 weeks of us being on boarded. Then we were given another rep who and vast experience with the DD product but was in a time zone that was not practical for us to work with. Then because of her health issues, we lost her. Next were assigned a new hire representative, they wanted to be helpful, but it never really worked out, and they left DD also.

So being bounced around was an issue. Having outstanding problems with the account for so long was a problem also. They were not problems that stopped us from marketing, just things were not set up right and we had some problems we were trying to get fixed.

Recommendations to others considering Dotdigital:
Make sure you take your time and get on boarded correctly. May issues we experience because of items missed or not mapped during set up.

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
The problems were account-based issues with abandoned cart mapping to a guest list.  Also, our post purchase review emails, the dynamic link generated was directing customers to an unstyled page on our Magento 2 site, the next DD update fixed this issue.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dotdigital?
The platform has endless options for creating email campaigns, automation emails, and indepth campaign reporting. The Dot Digital team is always there to help when we have queries. They are supportive and personalised in their approach. They also provide new marketing suggestions to help re-engage subscribers, offer product recommendations blocks, and general ideas for future campaigns.

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
Some aspects of the platform can be quite complex and not easily understood by a user. Although, the Dot Digital support team is always happy to walk us through these complexities.

Recommendations to others considering Dotdigital:
Great platform. Complex so you can dive deep with online marketing, although enough back-end support that you can always navigate your way around.

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
A big one was re-engaging customers, which succeeded with the re-engagement program they suggested. Also triggered emails, of great benefit to lessen the work load.

all_reviews.review_title: High rates for small plans, locked into annual contracts with no option of downgrade.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dotdigital?
Function email send platform. Drag and drop content editor works.

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
Automatically renewed in September with no direct decision of our team. We've sent less than 400 emails a month since, and have been charged PS200 per month. Support have told us there is no option to cancel, or even to downgrade without committing for a further year. This lack of support has resulted in us paying off the remainder of our term and ceasing to use the platform. Very disappointing.

Recommendations to others considering Dotdigital:
Be careful about automated renewal and lack of ability to cancel! Make sure you're ready to commit for a year, and stop it from autorenewing.

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
Customer comms emails. Marketing done with a different platform.

all_reviews.review_title: Great email marketing platform - slightly expensive
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dotdigital?
DotDigital is really easy to use. It's got an intuitive drag and drop email builder and lots of good templates to use.

The live chat is absolutely amazing! Everytime you have a question or issue, you can speak to them on live chat, and it will be sorted very quickly. The staff on the live chat will help you do the odd thing that you normally have to pay for such as custom coding of a temaplte.

They also offer courses which you can go to in London to learn more about how to maximize the use of the software, but it was quite expensive for what we got.

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
It's a little bit more expensive than some email marketing platforms. The flows are a bit difficult to set up. We also had issues with our billing which they took a while to sort out.

Recommendations to others considering Dotdigital:
If you have the budget, definitely try DotDigital for email marketing. It is a lot better than Mailchimp but more expensive.

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
Dotdigital offers an easy way to reengage and retain customers and increase ecommerce sales. There is great reporting, including graphs and charts that help ou easily see how your campaign has performed.

all_reviews.review_title: Easy to Use - Powerful Functionality
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dotdigital?
Moving to Dotdigital was a significant upgrade for our customer email programs. Love the flexibility in managing customer segments and building complex programs. Appreciate the cross-platform functionality with Magento, and how the Dotdigital team is regularly introducing enhancements (e.g. online chat, SMS messaging).

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
Some of the Magento functionality is buggy, and definitely requires careful testing (plus side...the Dotdigital technical support team is very reliable). The reporting modules in Dotdigital are ALMOST excellent...but lack a few basics that can be frustrating. All-in-all it's been a great partnership to-date.

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
Driving increased customer touch points through a wide range of email strategies.

all_reviews.review_title: Comprehensive solution for your email amd SMS marketing needs
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dotdigital?
Dotdigital's Engagement Cloud is super easy to use - the drag and drop functionality, as well as the wealth of customisation tools, has made it the platform of choice for our organisation for more than 10 years now. It's reasonably priced with excellent support. We're now looking to integrated Dotdigital in our Salesforce platform so hopefully that will give us even more opportunities for automation and experimentation.

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
The journey between the different stages of creating an email can be a bit of a pain - you can't jump 2 steps back or forward, for example. For certain sections, you can't order items by date/time modified, which makes it much more difficult to find your latest work. Small changes that can improve the user experience!

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
Targetting the right audiences and the right time with the right message. Making email marketing easy and accesible. Sorting out our SMS marketing and creating automation journeys that work for our members.

all_reviews.review_title: I highly recommend the dotdigital Engagement Cloud!
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dotdigital?
Having used past email marketing services, I have found dotdigital to be the most helpful, most modern, and most complete package currently available. The ease of use of the drag & drop builder makes designing emails that much easier, especially for busy marketing executives. The reporting functionality also offers a great range of information, which has been incredibly valuable to us as we had not used a tool as robust as dotdigital before. Additionally, the price you pay in exchange for dotdigital is highly competitive compared to other services out there.

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
One thing I would like to have added to dotdigital is the ability to have heatmaps. As I am a visual learner, I would like to see what areas of an email have the highest concentrated click rate at a glance. The numbered system works just as well; however, if the email is long, there are times I must scroll up and down to see the numbers. Other than that, I am happy with everything in the service dotdigital offers.

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
The problem we have solved with dotdigital was the usability of the drag and drop email builder. Previously we were using MailChimp; however, we felt it was a little clunky and hard to get used to. There were some designs we wanted to create, but there were some limitations we experienced. We have since solved this with the use of dotdigital.

all_reviews.review_title: Fit for purpose, not for the advanced
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dotdigital?
Easy to navigate and use as a system, it also lets the admin assign permissions to other users.
It has the ability to import a designed e-mail marketing template which can then be used, the tech support is also readily available on the live chat.
The system has extra features which allow it to stand out for it's competitors like SMS handling and live chat system.
For businesses which have a small team managing marketing automation then this would be a good purchase.
The interfact looks good and I could leave someone who has little to no experience to use the system and they would not struggle.
Gives me as the admin the ability to stop certain users from having certain permissions so can stop any mistakes happening for the company.

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
The support team are not the best and client satisfaction is clearly not a priority for them. No rewards for being a longstanding customer. Do not feel like a valued customer.
For what they are offering to me it personally seems costly. It is a system that has been around for quite a while, but I do not feel that it has moved with the times enough to make this competitive in the market.
It is quite a basic system which does not allow for much customisation. The sales team don't seem to speak to the customer success team etc, so one thing which has been discussed with another team will not be fed properly through the correct channels.
I have had technical issues which have meant delays in sending out communications and the team has been unable to help.
Old system and many others on the market just do the same as what this does, but better and for cheaper.

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
None - it does what the system is supposed to do, doesn't offer anything extra as far as I am concerned. Will be retiring the system this year, missed the cut off point for the cancellation.
There are features of the service which would have been interesting to get to use, however they do not offer trials or a way to test to the service before having to commit to a contract which is a mistake in my opinion. Just puts me of using the service further.

all_reviews.review_title: We switched to dotdigital Engagement Cloud a few years ago and haven't looked back...
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dotdigital?
We were initially drawn to dotdigital due to the straightforward and powerful automation builder. It's super simple to create and change journeys as and when required. It's also very easy to transfer data from other platforms into dotdigital via the API - reducing the amount of manual data processing you need to do.

The template and email builder are straightforward to use as well - which has allowed us to share the responsibilities of building and sending emails with the team, rather than having only one specialist user.

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
It's easy to overcome once you know the platform; however, I did find it tricky at first learning how to edit campaigns that were part of an automated journey. Once you add a campaign into a journey, it creates a new version within "Triggered campaign content," which is fine once you know it but could be made slightly clearer.

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
The critical problem that dotdigital helps us to solve - is being able to automate journeys that convert leads into donors. The process of setting up data links and running automated journeys, which include attractive and engaging emails, is so simple yet so powerful.

all_reviews.review_title: Very easy to use and segmentation is the best on the market
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dotdigital?
It's intuitive to use and the way in which different designs can be implement makes sure that a campaign will always go out looking flawless and will generate interest in what we are marketing on that particular day. I also like the  segmentation ability. This ability to segment has allowed us to create personalised campaigns that suit those who would be interested in receiving the newsfeed based on the preferences they have previously offered when signing up to our newsfeeds.

Aonther thing that I have found that I like is the ease of you. I have found that the platform is very easy to use. The layout is very clear and it is obvious how to navigate thee page in order to successfully complete and send out a campaign.  I also like the optimised send function. This function allows for an increase in open rates which can convert to click through rates. Anotehr thing that I like is the ability to preview the campaign before it is sent out. This allows for a thorough check out the campaign before it is sent out the rest of the mailing list. It is this ability that allows for a check for any potential errors and ensures we do not make any mistakes in our campaign before sending it out.

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
I've yet to find anything i dislike about it

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
Ways in which to taget the right people with content they will be interested in. A way to create campaigns quicker would be useful. Benefits include ease of segmentation

I also like the  segmentation ability. This ability to segment has allowed us to create personalised campaigns that suit those who would be interested in receiving the newsfeed based on the preferences they have previously offered when signing up to our newsfeeds.

Aonther thing that I have found that I like is the ease of you. I have found that the platform is very easy to use. The layout is very clear and it is obvious how to navigate thee page in order to successfully complete and send out a campaign.  I also like the optimised send function. This function allows for an increase in open rates which can convert to click through rates. Anotehr thing that I like is the ability to preview the campaign before it is sent out. This allows for a thorough check out the campaign before it is sent out the rest of the mailing list. It is this ability that allows for a check for any potential errors and ensures we do not make any mistakes in our campaign before sending it out.

all_reviews.review_title: King of customer segmentation, in relation to email marketing.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dotdigital?
dotdigital is the king, when it comes to data importation and segmentation. It makes it so easy to import vital customer data and create multiple segments within every single data stream we import , regardless of the source, size or use case. This has allowed us to segment every form of data we have, be it customer invoices or vital customer insights.

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
A/B hypothesis testing on dotdigital is very limited, especially when compared with mainstream alternatives out there. Asides this, I think my experience with dotdigital has been impressive.

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
We use dotdigital to power every aspect of our email marketing campaigns, be it transactional notifications or pure marketing emails. Dotdigitals strong point in terms of customer segmentation, ensures that we are sending our customers the kind of emails , which is likely to resonate with them.

all_reviews.review_title: User friendly and intuitive
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dotdigital?
Dotdigital is an email marketing tool and one that we have been using for several years. The platform is easy to use and very intuitive. There are lots of resources available if you want additional assistance. The ability to import external templates or create them yourself within the platform is one of the best features - as it means no matter your budget you can create bespoke email campaigns. There is a multitude of features such as building programs that we would love to use more often. Another great aspect of Dotdigital is the insights and thought leadership they share through their B2B newsletter and webinars (as well as in person events when these used to happen). It's a great way of finding out about the latest features of the software, or case studies from other companies.

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
The templates can at times be restrictive (in terms of image formats and sizes you can use etc.). However, this will depend on how the template is built so there is always a way around this.

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
Our main objective is keeping hundreds of B2B clients aware of our content and Dodigital allows us to do this quickly and easily. In addition we save time by being able to send out our newsletters using a template which is easy to update, with all of our contact lists in one place. It also allows our regional teams to work on the same projects within the same platform.

all_reviews.review_title: An easy to use software where you can send automated email campaigns to a large number of people.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dotdigital?
Weekly updates via emails with tips and tricks. Easy to use, practical, anyone can use it. It is very good to reach out to large audiences with a lot of feedback. Great templates to use, neat designs and very easy to amend old templates to keep a running theme going through email campaigns. Can create buttons to easily link to websites or generate emails with pre-inputted subjects to send to relevant email addresses.

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
Using a lot of various contact groups means a lot of background work when setting up contacts, but worthwhile once all set-up. May need some training surrounding generating contact lists and segmentation, but once learned, it can be a very useful tool.

Recommendations to others considering Dotdigital:
Very easy to use, anyone can learn how to use the system. Very good in a data reporting sense, lots of valuable insights. A short training session is required by an experienced user then you are away. Great to practice on email templates and engage with customers, whether it will be external providers or colleagues within your organisation.

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
Reaching a wide audience base whilst being able to track data including open rates etc. Keep an eye on who opens your emails, which colleagues interact and which do not open emails. Sending out advertisements to colleagues to promote certain courses in which we are looking for suitable delegates to attend. It is a very good way to determine interest in particular topics as we can see which parts of the emails have had the most engagement from staff.

all_reviews.review_title: Stronger 1:1 support is recommended
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dotdigital?
Automated our reminder to buy emails for products that have an expired lifespan.
Being able to access ROI reports per campaign, monitor performances of each campaign and programs.

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
Initially, it was exciting to begin using a brand new Marketing platform and one which would surpass Mailchimp.
As a novice to marketing, I had hoped that 1:1 onboarding over an initial 3 month (at least) would have been offered but this wasn't the case and the whole process felt very rushed. Training was 1 day and felt like a crash course/whirlwind. A softer approach and understanding of individual client requirements is essential to ensure that we, as a new client receives the required support from day one to allow us to confidently remove the stablisers from our bikes.

7 months in and we've found that there are areas of the platform that we still didn't know about because 1. We wouldn't know to look for this, and 2, because we weren't advised of this - being that we should've been made aware of the need to customise default values of a FIRSTNAME in case this value is empty in our Magento 2.x customer datafield.
Also, the Magento 2.x mapping environment for Dotdigital is apparently native to Magento/Adobe and Dotdigital have been unable to provide the best practise mapping techniques for this environment; so 90% of our outgoing emails are sent as manual campaigns or a triggered campaign/program.

A live chat tool routed to a Client management team would be very helpful to assist with quick questions.

Recommendations to others considering Dotdigital:
Email support is good and can take around 12 hours, but I do feel that if DD offered an account management support from day 1 to ensure our competence of their service, that this would have been much more helpful, perhaps our ship has sailed for this but it could help future clients.

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
Automated our reminder to buy emails for products that have an expired lifespan.

review_question_answers.question: What do you like best about Dotdigital?
review_question_answers.answer:
Automated our reminder to buy emails for products that have an expired lifespan.
Being able to access ROI reports per campaign, monitor performances of each campaign and programs.

Also, the Magento 2.x mapping environment for Dotdigital is apparently native to Magento/Adobe and Dotdigital have been unable to provide the best practise mapping techniques for this environment; so 90% of our outgoing emails are sent as manual campaigns or a triggered campaign/program.

A live chat tool routed to a Client management team would be very helpful to assist with quick questions.

review_question_answers.question: Recommendations to others considering Dotdigital:
review_question_answers.answer: Email support is good and can take around 12 hours, but I do feel that if DD offered an account management support from day 1 to ensure our competence of their service, that this would have been much more helpful, perhaps our ship has sailed for this but it could help future clients.

review_question_answers.question: What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
review_question_answers.answer: Automated our reminder to buy emails for products that have an expired lifespan.

all_reviews.review_title: Email automation at a breeze
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dotdigital?
Email workflow and infinite possibilities. With a few data points, it is very easy to set up dynamic workflows that treat all your customers correctly and engage them.

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
Integration with remote systems for data is often painful. You must use provided APIs rather than having a system coming to "peek and collect" only what is needed. Moreover, you must transfer all data in clear, and often sensible data of your customers.

Recommendations to others considering Dotdigital:
Make sure you want to buy a complete off the shelf solution. It is not always easy to decide if you want to build software in house or not. Sometimes, it is good to buy only bricks, and build the cement yourself, actually most of the successful digital businesses these last years were as such. Dotdigital provides a complete solution, and although it is module-based, you are in for a big leap.
If you are a startup, make sure it fits your costs, and can be used to gather more funds.

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
Sending transactional and promotional emails to targeted customers.
We've getting a better view to our segment, allowing to responding very differently to customers we want to engage on longer term with versus massive userbase.

all_reviews.review_title: Easy to use, with excellent customer service
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dotdigital?
For someone with minimal email building experience beforehand, Dotdigital is very easy to use, with an abundance of features in order to create the best possible email for our charity. The analytics reports are also very useful - we're able to use these to help inform our email program moving forward, and I cannot praise their customer service enough! The customer service agents are helpful, and are able to action any problems in a timely manner. I am a current user who builds a monthly email newsletter for the charity I work for.

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
Sometimes the formatting can be a little frustrating to deal with when using custom templates. It often makes it a little restricting when things are not displaying how we would like.

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
We've been increasing our engagement and keeping our regular donators/supporters warm with regular updates via several different email journeys - a monthly newsletter or sponsorship updates, for example. By using dotdigital, we've been able to keep all of our emails consistent in style, reach our audience and improve on what we're sending based on the tests and learnings from insights gathered by dotdigital engagement cloud.

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
When looking to move off the platform I was told by our rep that we were locked into an auto-renewed contract. I looked at our original contract from 2019 and it clearly stated that the contract would not auto-renew. I asked for a copy of the 2020 contract and the cancelation form and never heard from my rep again. The company proceeded to continue billing and threatening collections for a platform that was no longer being used. Its been 4 months and I still haven't  4 months and I still haven't heard back from my rep.

Recommendations to others considering Dotdigital:
Go with anyother platform

The created a ton of problems and resolved almost zero. Hubspot is a way better bang for your buck.

all_reviews.review_title: Easy to use, but would appreciate more detailed reporting functionality
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dotdigital?
Really easy to create emails, and the automation program functionality is detailed and intuitive. Support team are quick and helpful, and the company's 'extra-curricular' programming is really great.

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
I wish there were more capacity for reporting. Would like that to be a more customisable function (ie. buildable reports) - not just on campaigns, but on audiences. I wanted to be able to chart mailing list sign-ups over time, but doesn't seem to be possible.

Recommendations to others considering Dotdigital:
If you are using Spektrix CRM and ticketing software, Dotdigital integrates really well. Reporting isn't as customisable and functional as I would like, but the platform is really easy to use, and overall it works really well for us.

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
Email automation programs is the big thing we have started to invest in over the last couple of years. Dotdigital has made this really easy.

Recommendations to others considering Dotdigital:
If you use the platform daily or multiple times a week, you will be an expert in no time at all. The logic generally follows other platforms, but I found by only accessing a few times a month that I needed to take time finding some 'template' aspects to change. My account manager, Chris, or the support team were always super helpful to point me in the right direction when I got lost!

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
We have implemented a complex, automated database pulling data from multiple sources into Dotdigital. The benefit is that we have implemented a global, automated email program to communicate to our brand product owners. As a brand that sells mainly via retail partner stores, this is a real benefit.

What do you like best about Dotdigital?
Dotdigital is easy to use for beginners or less tech savy users.  The standard dashboard and creation of e-mail is easy.   The chat support is very good, I've not ever seen this high engagement within any other system.

The insights feature is nice, but cumbersome.

Segment feature also really works nice.

Great GDPR control

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
If you're an advanced users you start to be annoyed very quickly with many things in the systems.

Salesforce connection:
The Salesforce integration lacks a lot of features.  If you're used to e.g. Autopilot, Sharpspring, Hubspot, Marketing Cloud, Pardot  you quickly (unfortunually not during demo) notice Dotdigital needs to step up there game (for 2 years already).    Yes, the integration within Salesforce is great.  But all other sucks.  You  can't create tasks based on triggers, you can't  create opportunities based on triggers, etc etc.    The add contact / add lead trigger in automations works badly and only allows for syncing standard fields name, businessname, email, phone.    No customs fields are possible.  The whole integration interface is also terrible.    If you really want your marketing automation and CRM to work hand in hand, skip Dotdigital (for now, I hope!)

Zapier integration:
Same story as above, only some basic triggers.    Also only forms can be the trigger.  Not a node within your automation program for example or an action within an e-mail.

Fields:
Very basic stuff. They've been promising for 2 years now to make this better. But it's getting postponed each time.

Chat:
I have  not yet used it personaly, but from the looks it is a to soon released product.  What botters me the most is that Dotdigital isn't even using there own chat program, no they used Intercom and a other chat program.   Honestly, a company that is not using it's own products is very bad

Webinsights:
Compare this to any other MA tool and you see the tracking options are lacking, all data is hard text, nothing is visual, there is no realtime feed, no pre-recognision etc etc.   It works okay, but not good enough for the price you pay.

Forms and pages:
Some things work great and are thought out, but many things aren't:  The forms have a horrible user experience to built.   Even basic field types are missing, you can only have dependencies/logic flows on 2 or 3 basic fields.   Really, if you are used to Formidable Forms, Gravity Forms, Hubspot etc the experience is heroundus.   The stats/reporting is even worse on the forms.

Pages allow tracking which is nice. But you need to manually add this to each and every page. Which sucks!

Contactlist:
can only be searched on e-mailadress which makes no sense.  If you want to find a specific person it's a needle in the haystack.  Also the contactpages are incomplete lacking for example filled in forms or a a visual view of pages that have been visited on your website.

Emailing: most features are amazing when it comes to email, but the whole dynamic posting is not thought out. You can only do this on very view parameters, needing a lot of hassle for an easy task.

Automations: In the basic it works. But I would prefer a lot more different type of nodes. A lot better integration with third parties like Wordpress, Salesforce, Zapier etc.

Recommendations to others considering Dotdigital:
Really make sure what you want to do.  Basic emailing, with good segments, great GDPR control and basic automations and Dotdigital is a great fit.
If you want more advanced options including a GOOD intergration with Salesforce, don't use Dotdigital for now.  The product can be much better if they give more thought into the Zapier and Salesforce integration (task, oppertunity creation,   add, remove and change member status in campaigns, create campaigns etc).

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
Sending emails, collectiong data, creating automations based on  CRM data.

all_reviews.review_title: Great drag and drop email marketing tool
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dotdigital?
It was really easy to get up to speed quickly, creating email templates on brand, and creating segments for audiences.

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
There were limitations to the method of AB testing, which wasn't there for other email marketing told I've used in other roles.

Recommendations to others considering Dotdigital:
Dotdigital is a really simple to use tool, and the support is great - often I've sent an instant message to the support team, and they've always answered my questions. The online training is also excellent. The AB testing was limited, and the higher reporting functionality required some technical understanding, but neither of these minor drawbacks negatively impacted the marketing content we shared to our audiences.

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
Sending out on brand emails (one off alerts and newsletters) to our mailings lists.

all_reviews.review_title: Flexible System with Powerful Triggered Capabilites
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dotdigital?
The integrations with paid search and Facebook, allowing you to sync audiences across platforms.
The flexibility of the segments and automation builds.
LiveChat can often offer instant solutions to problems which would take days/weeks to resolve over email.

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
The speed to trigger a 'welcome' email to a new email subscriber.
That the Shopify connector has an 'all or nothing' implementation - as in you have to use all of it's features or none.
There's no warning when you're about to hit your contact or send limits.

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
The ability to sync audiences with PPC and Facebook allows you to target the same customer through multiple channels.
Introducing more automated programs to better segment and target our customers. By capturing due date through our welcome program we have been able to target customers with triggered emails that are relevant to the stage of their pregnancy.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dotdigital?
Engagement Cloud is a very powerful yet easy to use solution, with a clear and intuitive user interface and powerful marketing automation features.

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
It would be useful to be able to report on triggered email performance by a date range, currently the reports only show the full lifetime of the campaign and it is difficult to drill down further by date.

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
The software enables us to communicate effectively with our email subscriber base, and underpins the onboarding and engagement for our digital subscription service.

all_reviews.review_title: Absolutely recommending
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dotdigital?
It is very user-friendly, simple, self-explanatory. If you have never used the tool, you will be able to learn the basics in a matter of hours.
The automation includes templates, the segmentation as well, you just need to want to use it, as everything is there.

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
Nothing to complain about, really. I have been using it for more than 3 years and I can't say something is missing.

Recommendations to others considering Dotdigital:
Definitely recommend it, everything from the support team, account management, usability

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
As a global company, we have an extensive distribution list and need to keep in touch with our customers and future customers - DotDigital is a perfect tool to keep you and your customer connected. Be it with marketing emails or crucial operation updates.

reviewer.reviewer_job_title: Internal communications & staff engagement global lead

all_reviews.review_title: Great tool, but learning curve when you first start
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dotdigital?
Lots of tools to utilize, but a little overwhelming when you're first getting started. The segmentation tool allows you a lot of freedom to create segments of any time. The integration with the Magento 2 platform is very extensive so you have a lot of data to pull from when creating those segments. Our Onboarding rep and Account manager have also been super helpful and responsive to our requests!

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
Initial set-up when you first start using the platform is a little overwhelming and daunting, but our Onboarding rep was super helpful. We ran into a ton of issues integrating with Magento, so it took a while to troubleshoot everything. DotDigital is unable to really help with issues on the Magento end, so it was tough troubleshooting some issues such as transactional emails or abandoned cart emails. We had some difficulty with the "External Content" for automated emails that Support was unable to get to the bottom of. It's difficult to test the "External Content" unless you are actively triggering the emails from the website.

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
We're able to utilize segmentation in our email strategy now because of the extensive segmentation tool DotDigital has. This will allow us to better target customers with our emails.

The integration with the Magento 2 platform is very extensive so you have a lot of data to pull from when creating those segments. Our Onboarding rep and Account manager have also been super helpful and responsive to our requests!
