all_reviews.review_title: Easy to use, functional and all round good product
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dotdigital?
I really like how easy it is to get to grips with the platform - I've been using it for several years now and this is my second organisation that I've used it at. Had my organisation not been in the process of getting Dotdigital as I arrived, I would have recommended it to them!

The drag and drop build is very useful for those who can't write HTML, I train others up around the organisation to use Dotdigital and this is a very helpful feature. So simple to explain!

Dynamic content is another saviour from having to build multiple emails when you can just do it all in one.

Automation is something we used more at my previous organisation but you can build journeys based off of what people click on to make the most relevant journey for them.

And, surveys - not only used them in emails but also internally (not sure they're really intended for that though!)

Test sends and previewing is super easy which makes for a great email when delivered.

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
I dislike the fact that people can unsubscribe from one email and it takes them off all email lists when they might only not want to hear from that email. I know you can get around this by having a child account but it's an extra expense.

Recommendations to others considering Dotdigital:
Go for it! I much prefer it to other email providers I've tried and I feel the data is safe with them!

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
We're making stewardship journeys simpler and more customized. We learning from the data that we get back from sends to perform better in the next one.

We're also just starting to use SMS marketing which seems to be improving our click-to-open rate.

all_reviews.review_title: One of the better options for large-scale EMS
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dotdigital?
Excellent opportunities for easy to understand automation (and a pretty nicely designed UX). We've run a variety of short-term (6 week) programmes more efficiently via the dotdigital Engagement Cloud - previously dotmailer.

There's a good level of personalisation available for campaigns created in the product and a coupe of tools to try and better join up email and PPC advertising.

We have also found success using the chat function on the dotmailer site in order to solve problems within a reasonably timeframe.

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
dotdigital's creative products tend to be a little boxy, but this also means they are easy to pick up for junior members of the team. It can also be hard to ensure you're effectively utalising all the elements unless you have a keen superuser on your team - especially if you have a larger package that incorporates more of the functionalities.

Unfortunately dotdigital also seems to have a high turnover for Account Manager and they are frequently hard to reach or unresponsive even for billing issues or new account creation (hence the reliance on the chat feature for quick fixes).

Recommendations to others considering Dotdigital:
As a high cost product, I would ensure you have a team willing to learn and adapt to ensure they are getting the most out of your dotdigital Engagement Cloud contract. You may find that you're paying for features you don't need, or more likely, won't have the time to leverage.  And you can quickly discover you need specific features that are not part of the package you purchase.

I would question the rep on the level of support and training available and ensure this works with your organisation.

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
The segmentation options on the platform are great and easy to manipulate, with most using a 'drag and drop' matrix, that means it's simple for the team to create and test data-driven email campaigns quickly.

We've also utalised the ability to easily automate messages off the back of customers actions, things like welcome campaigns etc. even with limited data touch points.

review_question_answers.question: What do you like best about Dotdigital?
review_question_answers.answer:
Excellent opportunities for easy to understand automation (and a pretty nicely designed UX). We've run a variety of short-term (6 week) programmes more efficiently via the dotdigital Engagement Cloud - previously dotmailer.

There's a good level of personalisation available for campaigns created in the product and a coupe of tools to try and better join up email and PPC advertising.

We have also found success using the chat function on the dotmailer site in order to solve problems within a reasonably timeframe.

dotdigital's creative products tend to be a little boxy, but this also means they are easy to pick up for junior members of the team. Unfortunately dotdigital also seems to have a high turnover for Account Manager and they are frequently hard to reach or unresponsive even for billing issues or new account creation (hence the reliance on the chat feature for quick fixes).

all_reviews.review_title: Customer engagement made simple.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dotdigital?
Having experienced multiple other platforms, Dotdigital is really simple to use and enables efficient communications with our clients and contacts.  We have seen considerable ROI and improvement in managing our time using them through automation.  We are looking closely at the engagement rates for our campaigns and noticing a gradual increase in these over time.  We've also seen a big difference in the support and customer care we receive from the Dotdigital team and they're always enthusiastic about emails and are constantly helping with new ideas and ways of working through and optimising campaigns.

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
You need to commit time and effort in setting up your campaigns but thats the same whatever platform you're using.  Navigation between adding a contact and including them in a campaign could be made easier as the user journey is not as intuitive as it could be.  However this is not really a serious issue as once you get the hang of it you barely notice it.

Recommendations to others considering Dotdigital:
Evaluate what you'll be using the platform for and what RIO you'll need from your campaigns.  Always run through your ideas and plans with Dotdigital's team and they can best advise you on whether you need Dotdigital.   We found them to be very upfront and honest if there isn't a good fit.

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
We're able to more closely manage campaigns and followups based on reporting within the system.  We know who's looking at what when we communicate. More functionality built into the platform also has benefits as far as opening up future options for campaigns.  We have sent several campaigns already and these were delivered with lower bounce rates and higher open rates with click throughs increasing too.  We were then able to track these and engage with the recipient based on what they clicked and so this had a knock on effect with our sales tracking.  Ease of use as far as design and adjusting templates is  not difficult at all, with drag and drop being a huge benefit as well as use of prebuilt templates that reflect most email design requirements and scenarios.

What do you like best about Dotdigital?
Where to start. The robust dashboard of DotDitigal is far superior than anything else I have worked with. My favorite piece is creating the custom user journeys. I can tailor these campaigns a MILLION ways. Plus, the reporting dashboard is fantastic and provides great insight into my ROI. The one feature that we love the most is the chat feature. I can assign it to other team members.

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
DotDigital is not something that you can just 'set and forget'. You have to put the time and effort into learning the system. It can be confusing at first.  If you take the time to learn the system, it will be worth it. There should be more documentation for this for people to use as resources.

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
Our marketing campaigns are better than ever. We have so many campaigns for different customer groups.

all_reviews.review_title: Dotdigital is a lifesaver, love this program
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dotdigital?
The user friendliness of the software, all the features, ability to LEARN with the platform (it's very intuitive so it feels manageable to take on chunks of new learning) and the support is unmatched among any other ecommerce tech I use. I can always rely on our account manager, another account manager if they are away, or the support team for quick assistance. They always walk me through things when I am doing something for the first time or reassure me when I am taking on new tasks. Dotdigital has also been one of those tools that is quite easy to train new staff up on!

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
not heaps - I would say some of the functions in campaign builder can be a tiny bit clunky but it's nothing major. Occasionally we have had the odd glitch but our CSM or support always helps. I wish there were more options for throttling campaigns over longer periods of time. Also a bit better image manager. I would highly recommend anyone looking to go with dotdigital. It far supersedes our previous provider. The reporting could be slightly improved, and perhaps some better way of showing reports for multiple campaigns joined, as we often send the same campaigns out to different segments and as such we lose some of that combined detailed reporting (there are definitely some work arounds, but unfortunately not quite as clean as it could be!)

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
email campaigns, triggered content, promotions for our customers, re engagement. Solving clunky manual processes. One for example is an omnichannel rewards promotion we do on a yearly basis around the holiday period in Australia. We struggle to find a way to deliver this offering online to match our store offering (a large priority for our company is to have parallel offerings between our online and store experiences, to ensure our customers' needs and desired are met fairly across channels) and dotdigital allowed us to automate this by creating programs that our customers are entered into once they meet the given criteria for that specific promotion. We eliminated the need to manually create and send out these vouchers by using the very seamless magento - dotdigital connections, and as such have been able to leverage unique, auto generated coupon codes for our customers that expire on a given day. Through dotdigital, we have been able to clearly communicate these promotions to our customers. We have also been able to remind and prompt them to utilise these promotions, and generate further sales.

all_reviews.review_title: Handy Tool with a high learning curve for begginers and intermediates
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dotdigital?
I like that it is easy to use and does not require any IT background. It is great that all the important aspects (Landing Pages, Surveys, Reporting) are included. The Training made it easy to get into it and see what you can actually do with the tool. Also the learning hub and the support library are well structured and filled with tutorials that help with problems and to improve processes.

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
The livechat for support is great and you'll get solutions for any kind of problems very fast. However, if the problem is somehow more difficult to solve it takes quite long for the development team until you get an answer. The good thing is, that the support always kept me updated so that I know that no one forgot me. The Drag-and-Drob editor was sometimes a bit laggy and surely takes away a bit of freedom for experienced developers or users that normally use HTML. On the other Hand it is great for beginners and experts can still design their templates in the HTML editor.

Recommendations to others considering Dotdigital:
Use the Training in order to get the most out of the Tool. The trainers are great and show in easy real-life campaigns what one can do with the tool and how to combine all features together. It gave me some great inspiration and was a good kickstart for the use of the tool.
If there are occurring any problems. especially in the beginning of the use, I recommend to take a look in the help centre where they explain how to solve the most common problems

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
Automated Programs for lead generation,
We wanted to create automated programs for lead generation and to nurture prospects along the customer journey. Stay in touch with customers on a regular basis and inform them about the newest trends.

all_reviews.review_title: Professional tool which delivers what is promised support by competent people
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dotdigital?
The tool delivers exactly what is promised. The onbaording was very clear and professional. We are surrounded with competent and professional people who are always happy to help. The communication is timely, clear and to the point. They are very patient and always available to help when needed. The knowledge base is extensive and is a very good addition to their support services. My team is able to get things done and we know we can count on Dot Digital whenever we need it. It's nice to have a reliable partner.

The tool itself is very powerful and has al our required features. Good segmentation, robust and reliable email services, good looking and easy to use customisation options.

The engagement cloud is not cheap, but we believe it is fairly priced.

Having this tool integrated with Magento out-of-the box makes it all very convenient.

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
The overview and interface is fresh and modern but takes some getting use to and is not 'self-explanatory'. The fact you need an onboarding proves their is some margin for improvement to get to a self-service self-explanatory platform. I'm not sure this is possible, but there is certainly room for improvement.

I already mentioned the price as being fair, but it doesn't change the fact it is expensive. This results in it not being very accessible to smaller companies. You need a certain volume of sales to justify this investment.

Recommendations to others considering Dotdigital:
If you can afford it, go with the flow and let you be guided by a good team which knows what it is doing.

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
Complete automation of most of our emailing. Full integration with our webshop off-the-shelve.

all_reviews.review_title: Versatile and Robust Marketing Engagement Platform
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dotdigital?
I like the ability to create campaigns tailored to my target audiences needs and allow me to build email campaigns with dynamic content that drives sales. The automation programs portion is super diverse as well. I really enjoy being able to tailor certain content in toward mobile users as well as desktop users which helps create responsive email designs. It's Zapier integration has worked great to connect other marketing tools in our library to build a really well rounded platform to work from.

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
There is a little bit of a learning curve which can take some time to overcome but once you spend the time working with the software there are very few limits to what you can do with it. I wish the landing page/form portion of the platform was a little more design focused, right now it's quite simple and not very easy to brand. I also dislike how it currently natively lacks full width background colours, we had to purchase that as a separate cost to integrate into our template.

Recommendations to others considering Dotdigital:
It's incredibly useful once you get past the learning curve and could really drive forward any marketing efforts put forward by internal or external marketing teams.

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?

all_reviews.review_title: dotdigital Engagement Cloud
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dotdigital?
I like being able to manually update lists with excel files and constantly readjust emails so they look good on all platforms so that everything works with just a few clicks. It is one of the largest marketing software in the world. Millions of customers, from small e-commerce stores to large online retailers, use this software to express themselves to the world. At first it is difficult to understand, then it is easy. During the last years it has become our almost daily use tool to be in contact with our clients. It has the ability to use its visual editor and its functions to easily write / design the campaign and test it in a real mail client. Unlike other email marketing softwares, there are no EXTRA features / functionalities that you would rarely need. You can edit multiple emails on multiple tabs, which makes copying, It is my 100% white hat email marketing software for projects. I quickly develop my momentum in creating emails, reaching a more free-will audience and bringing relevant content to my emails.

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
The support can be a little callous at times when you have breached one of its terms / policies (even when it happens by accident and you are not sure what you did wrong, even to activate it). One day they close your account because the subject of your website does not enter their company policy. I'm over One day they close your account because the subject of your website does not enter their company policy. I'm over The only thing I'm not 100% fan of is the Events section, it doesn't have the drag and drop generator.

Recommendations to others considering Dotdigital:
It is a very efficient way to always stay connected and these tools are the best when it comes to presenting videos to the client with excellent image editor tools that allow a better job development such as an electronic form, customizable models and management of the Web page.

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
It is a program that is not free where almost all the key functions are offered. It conveys the feeling of being in front of a modern cloud-based software application. Although the overall workspace is good, it has many features that a small business won't need.

all_reviews.review_title: A Complete Not-So-Known email marketing solution
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dotdigital?
The product offers a pleasant marketing environment that is appreciated, simple and fair, as it is not only an email marketing software, but also has tools for campaign management and automation of marketing processes. Its interface is easy to use and very clear for new users, you can create email campaigns, pages, forms, and even SMS from the same home page of this platform. I love being able to track the campaign emails we launch and measure the company's marketing reach.

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
Despite having within the suite an implementation of artificial intelligence to recommend settings for program automation, it does not work properly, templates are unusable due to being outdated to current marketing programs. You have to create everything from scratch and little help is received from AI referrals.

Recommendations to others considering Dotdigital:
There are many reasons why I can recommend this product, I can start with the loyalty of the seller, always aware of any problems you have in your beginnings with the software, also the product is solid even if it has its low points. Another point to highlight is that the product has many ways to deploy marketing campaigns.

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
We have been able to launch various marketing campaigns and loyalty programs to our clients thanks to the tools enabled by our dotdigital enterprise plan. Not everything has been easy with this program, but its simplicity helps to create, from scratch, email campaigns to all our targets and leads and boost our services. We will soon be working on another email project and dotdigital will be the tool we will use for it again.

all_reviews.review_title: dotdigital Engagement Cloud Review
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dotdigital?
Dotdigital is a good email marketing tool. I like being able to both create specific emails personalized for each costumer and track my email campaigns. Once you get familiarized whith dotdigital Engagement Cloud, it is easy to use and designing mails is easy too. For instance, dotdigital has templates for massive emails. In adittion, dotdigital allows each one of the team members to custom data views in order to suit their preferences and needs. Something extra is that dotdigital Engagement Cloud has the support of a big and experienced company, and this generates trust.

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
The price of dotdigital Engagement Cloud, compared to similar products, is a little high. Also there is a learning curve to start using it. Everytime I try a new feature it takes me a while to learn the details.  Sometimes, the interface is difficult to navigate.

Recommendations to others considering Dotdigital:
Based on clients positive responses, it is totally worth it. Dotdigital is a great tool. If you still have doubts, you can start with the free trail. Plus, if you have any problem their support team is always available.

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
I can automatize emails by combining information from more than one channel (ads, video, social media). The reports of  effectiveness and incidence of the email campaigns of dotdigital make work much easier. In this sense, I use the list and schedules to organized my email sending (so I do not have tons of .doc anymore) . Futhermore, it facilitates work from home and allows collaborative work, so more than one member of the team can work on the email desing. Also, dotdigital allows the integration with ecommerce providers.

all_reviews.review_title: Marketing automation to be more efficient
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dotdigital?
Dotdigital Engagement has stepped up our marketing to be more agile, more efficient and fundamentally more data driven, meaning we are able to track and analyze our marketing actions and iterate them to be more meaningful on the messages we send to our customers.

Their multiple integrations with CRM tools allow us to tie our marketing efforts with the revenue they generate which is key for the growth of the company.

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
The only thing where there is room for improvement is on e mail editing, where more options should be available. Other than that, a great piece of software.

Recommendations to others considering Dotdigital:
You will not regret hiring this service.

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
With Dotidgital I am able to be more efficient on how to do marketing and with the help of the support team I keep finding new uses for the product. I have recently done more integrations to tie marketing actions to generated sales, which is a big plus.

all_reviews.review_title: Do the job but need to improve
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dotdigital?
Because of how responsive the support was is actually one of the most pleasurable experiences I have had with a service like this, usually agents suggest solutions that lack real value to the problem that the user may have and therefore end up without fixing anything at all, with this software was quite the opposite of that so I was really pleased of how the whole process went. The options for adding different elements to the surveys designs have been a great help in customizing our content and delivering to the end user a product of high quality.

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
Certain modules lack a little more depth in their functions, it is necessary to implement more elements to add to the forms as well as improve the editor that is used for the creation of these. We've had some some rendering issues on somewhat old mobile devices so our content looks perfect for new versions of mobiles but for older versions we needed to configure other settings to fix these kind of issues.

ActiveCampaign is one of the most well known software for email automation and email campaigns, both software turn out to be quite efficient in terms of the rate of emails delivered without problems and at the same time maintain a very low number of emails that end up as spam. However DotDigital takes the lead in terms of price which is much more competitive and taking into account all its functions it provides, so for this particular point it is the most attractive option to choose.

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
Collaboration is one of the benefits that this application has brought without even noticing, our team of developers have been able to maintain a constant feedback that is of great help to review different tasks that need more attention or if it is necessary to inform the manager of the progress of the project that is being developed at that time, keeping us all aware of everything that is going on in our department.

all_reviews.review_title: Best Email+ Solution
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dotdigital?
Engagement cloud is the best and most affordable email solution, providing a direct connection to our Magento shopping cart website and the ability to send automated and dynamic content. In this day and age, companies need to personalize every communication that goes out; Engagement Cloud makes that happen.

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
There is a bit of a learning curve with getting switched over and a long process to get it going, but they give you all of the support you would need and detailed training.

Recommendations to others considering Dotdigital:
My advice...choose the Amplify package of Engagement Cloud! If you are a consumer product goods company, you have to be able to pull in dynamic content to the email and have it automatically pull in items in their wishlist or in their cart. It is a game-changer, especially if you are using Magento. Be sure to allow several months to go through the implementation process, but don't worry Dot Digital will be with you and guide you every step of the way. They provide a dedicated account manager for setup and implementation that is available every week for a call to keep everything on track. I have also used Salesforce/Marketing Cloud, and this is easier and way more affordable.

They also have other solutions besides email that compliment communications such as chat and sms options.

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
With other platforms, we weren't able to segment based on the categories that were included from several different sites; with Dot Digital's Engagement Cloud, we now can. We can build out custom segments based on the industries that we serve which are huge for our business.

all_reviews.review_title: Exactly what we needed from a feature-rich, easy-to-use platform
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dotdigital?
The layout & navigation of the platform is very quick to learn. Putting together automation workflows and setting up segments was a breeze, something that we didn't enjoy with our last email provider. Support team and account manager were super-helpful and quick to answer any questions we had. Delivery rates also far surpass those of our last email provider. When it comes to the email builder itself, Dotdigital is one of the first email service providers I've used where the email builder doesn't make me want to put my fist through the computer screen. Very quick learning curve, and very easy to layout blocks and blocks within blocks exactly how I want them to be.

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
To be honest, nothing. Maybe tone it down on how long before you're automatically logged out (around 1 hourish)! Seriously though, there are only a couple of things I'd change;
- Using spacers when building emails is quite fiddly, especially when trying to horizontally align different elements. Quite often in the email builder and in testing, the elements spaced using spacers will look aligned with each other, and then upon viewing in inbox they aren't.
- When viewing contacts within a segment or address, when I select the dashboard to show a certain field value, I'm unable to sort by that field value, only email address.

Recommendations to others considering Dotdigital:
Take some time before sending out your first campaign to do test runs of different features - sending out a few test campaigns, test automation, segment building etc.

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
Using our bespoke CRM in tandem with a feature-rich ESP using API to effectively retarget customers.

all_reviews.review_title: Great email marketing automation tool
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dotdigital?
I find the solution allows me to easily and quickly build  personalised, automated triggered campaigns. The campaigns themselves look good on both desktops, tablets and smaller devices. It's easy to upload and manage contact lists and then segment these clients based on different criteria. The reporting is also quick and easy and tells me everything I need to know about the campaigns.

I find the webinars very helpful and also the support pages are insightful

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
The survey and form generator is very basic and lacks some functionality and does not have much customaizability in terms of look and feel - it feels quite outdated compared to the rest of the platform. I think that it would be great to be able to customize the font family via Google Fonts and the colours.

It would also be great if there could be dynamic fields that appear depending on answers of previous questions.

Recommendations to others considering Dotdigital:
I'd recommend attending their webinars.

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
The platform has allowed us to automate some contact and engagement processes to ensure clients receive consistent and well branded messaging. This means our clients receive regular updates. The reporting tools are simple to use so we now know how many clients are engaging with the content and who is not engaging. This allows us to tailor our content accordingly to ensure the best ROI. The A/B testing feature is great as it means we can easily experiment with different subjects and images.

dotdigital Engagement is the perfect tool for marketers to automate different marketing campaigns through emails, I really consider dotdigital Engagement is a universal platform as it is well known in many countries, dotdigital allows from designing, testing and sending powerful automated campaigns, one of the features that I love about dotdigital is that it integrates perfectly with e-commerce platforms like Shopify, BigCommerce and different marketing automation software packages like Magneto Commerce. all_reviews.review_title: Excellent Communications Platform that gives a proven return on investment
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dotdigital?
Simple, easy to use and results based :)  The system has numerous benefits including the comprehensive reporting at the back end.  We now have the ability to see WHO our most engaged people are - at any given time.   We have also been able to identify what days, times and even where best to place links in individual communication pieces - all down to the reporting. The drag and drop creation process is simple and very easy to use.  We save our own 'regular branded bits' in our library and simply dag them across in to the relevant slot in each communications piece.  We recently had someone claim that they never received a communications piece, however I was able to tell them the exact time and date they received it - and that they had actually opened it - which was massively beneficial to us, when putting our conversation forward.

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
Sometimes the header tags drift to include body copy, for example the whole paragraph becomes Header 1, when you only selected the 'heading' in the cell.  There is also no Spell Check which has proven challenging when sending out short-notice communication pieces.  Temporary fields in the address book would also be helpful - for example when segmenting your audience with data that you may not always need to have in the system.

Recommendations to others considering Dotdigital:
Use the system - it sells itself

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
One source of information. Tailored communications personalised to the individuals.  Stronger traction and calls to action have already been experienced as a result of smaller, simpler more effective communication messages.  The platform has enabled us to make sure our communications pieces are consistent, professional, tailored, personalised and measured - something we have never been able to do 'successfully'.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dotdigital?
The platform ticks a lot of boxes when it comes to its suite of features, and I rarely find myself saying 'no dotdigital cannot do that' when considering the possibilities for a digital marketing campaign. Certainly one of the better SaaS based marketing suites I've used in my career and despite its shortcomings I would certainly recommend it for a team of digital savvy marketers.

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
Gaining access to all features can push costs up. I was shocked when I discovered the cost of simply setting up an additional 'From Address' for our business. Whilst the platform can do a lot certain platform limitations can also create additional work at times, requiring workarounds to get the job done. If I'm honest it can be too complex for less 'geeky' members of the marketing team, with me having to train and supervise users at times.

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
We've predominantly used the platform to handle a myriad of email marketing campaigns across various business units, and its simple but effective form/survey and landing page builder helps with those campaigns that need the added user interaction and tracking. We've custom API's built to handle new customer accounts with automated emails and segmentation/list building is not a problem, even when handling limited data from multiple sources.

all_reviews.review_title: Great simple to use platform
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dotdigital?
My favourite thing about dotdigital is that it is so easy to use, you simply drag and drop content into different fields. Once you are comfortable with the basics there are then so many other features that you can learn about and add to your campaigns.

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
The only thing I struggle with is some of the slightly 'glitchy' elements like how to copy a template seems like a slightly convoluted process. Also sometimes the high security level at the login stage can be frustrating as it feels like I have to constantly reconfirm my account details as being genuine.

Recommendations to others considering Dotdigital:
dotdigital is suitable for users at all levels within a business, it's a great way to ensure that we can communicate locally or globally, whilst staying 'on brand'. Our brand and digital teams now have more time to work on complex marketing campaigns, whilst the local marketing teams have the freedom to create their own email comms.

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
dotdigital enables us to keep what would otherwise be a disparate 'group' of retails up to date on our brand and trade activities in a professional way. It is helping to alleviate workload for the digital team.

all_reviews.review_title: Great Customer service, powerful system
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dotdigital?
The great customer service, and advisers who help fix problems> They are always on hand to help with any query no matter how big or small this may be. Whether its a tiny issue that only requires a quick prompt, to a system wide issue that require in-depth technical analysis.Another great system is the automation feature, that allows you to build paths, triggered responses and programs that can do automatic email tasks without the need for constant user input. this helps clean our list up of unwatned emails, send out promotions based on purchase history, re-engage lapsed customers and a host of other tasks that without automation would take a lot of user man hours to do.

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
Sometimes the interface is slow, and takes a while to load when viewing previously sent campaigns. This can be frustrating, but not the end of the world. Another area that is slow is when loading the cloud stored images for email, they can sometimes load slowly if the file you are trying to open is large.

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
Reaching a large number of customers whilst using automation to clean our lists without us having to do this on a day-today basis.

all_reviews.review_title: DotDigital Does Everything And More!
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dotdigital?
I have never got to a point with dotdigital where i was unable to do something we needed to implement, the ease of the navigation and site features allow me to figure out exactly how to do each task we set ourselves.

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
There isn't much as recent updates have brought surveys up to scratch with what we would expect from campaign manager. If i had to choose something i would say web insights are quite hard to view on a contact by contact basis which often puts me off looking this closely at this the data.

Recommendations to others considering Dotdigital:
What i would say is use the example programs to build a base of simple programs. The sooner you automate the basics the better. I found biting off more than you can chew from the get go makes the task more difficult than it needs to be.

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
In the 3 years of using dotdigital i haven't yet thought of a idea for a program, email or feature that i wanted to implement into our marketing and it not be able to be fulfilled by dot digital or a partner they suggest. This has allowed us to be constantly developing and moving forward which has worked wonders for our ROI and total revenue.

all_reviews.review_title: Fantastic Functionality
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dotdigital?
I like that the functions within DotMailer provide a clean email which, when sent, look fantastic. The ability to access the analytics for each email is also very helpful and provides a comprehensive insight into the email performance. The ability to split test within the application and for it to be as easy as it is is fantastic.The ease of setting up new users on the platform is fantastic with different levels of access dependant on job title. It is also fantastic to be able to schedule emails into the future and this is a feature that we use a lot within our organisation.

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
Being unable to downgrade package as per business requirements. Being able to be more flexible in approach to emails used would be fantastic. However, with much understanding and conversation, I now understand why this isn't possible. This comes down more to a design point but it is sometimes difficult to get access to perfectly aligned emails but as time goes on and you learn how to use the platform, this get's easier.

Recommendations to others considering Dotdigital:
I would advise people to carefully think about the amount of emails they are going to be sending. Do not sign up for a package that is too many as you will not be able to claim back the money at a later date.

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
As explained above, the ability to downgrade a package mid-term is fantastic but the reasons behind not being able to are understandable. However, the ability to save high-res images within the platform is a large bonus and something I haven't noticed with other providers.

all_reviews.review_title: Offers everything you need!
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dotdigital?
I love how easy it is to use! The platform helps you build programmes, segments and campaigns without any problems...Dotdigital let's you do everything really easily, which is great when your online marketing team are busy and do not have the time to dedicate to sussing out how to set things up. They can get straight to implementation. The reporting is great too.

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
It is quite expensive so may not be suitable for smaller organisations or those with limited budgets. On occasion, the support is rather reactive rather than proactive.

Recommendations to others considering Dotdigital:
For larger organisations or organisations with large contact lists, dotdigital is a fantastic solution not only for email campaigns but also automation, form building, managing customer data and personalisation. The price means it may not be a suitable solution for smaller businesses.

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
In the last year, we have been able to solve several challenges: GDPR compliance, lowered open rates (we used A/B testing), gathering data from landing pages...All of this has been achieved really successfully through Dotdigital. We have also been able to create a preference centre for our international brands without web development, which is brilliant and cost-effective, especially as we are moving platforms.

all_reviews.review_title: Gets the Job Done for a B2B Midsize Digital Marketing Department
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dotdigital?
- Good support team is always responsive and follows up quickly.
- Platform has good deliverability vs freemium options
- Good automation builder
- WYSIWYG is solid and accurately represents what customers see
- transparent billing
- some interesting metrics captured in the reporting, which is hampered by a lack of features in the reporting area of the tool.

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
- I wish datafields had dropdown options for the field types.
- Sometimes a bit slow when loading lots of assets
- asset manager is simple and ok
- knowledge base could get some more frequent updates
- more focus on mobile responsiveness for landing pages.
- needs better analytics and reporting environment, or at least a connection via API to other systems.

Recommendations to others considering Dotdigital:
Rank features into buckets of "must have" "nice to have" "not important" and see if dot digital meets your needs. Also, be aware of some of the areas, like deliverability, which some of the "popular" vendors struggle with.

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
We were between the "email monkey" competitor and enterprise email systems $$$. We needed something to manage complex lists of customers across many regions and the ability to add custom data fields.

Dotdigital fit the bill accordingly. Does it have everything you could ever want? No. but it has the core base of features that a midsize marketing department needs to run a email and digital campaign strategy. The juniors on my team can use the EasyEditor without knowing all of the ins and outs of email design and the design is reproduced faithfully in email clients.

all_reviews.review_title: At your fingertips
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dotdigital?
The training that I received was great. I like the graphic approach to the automation... it makes it much easier to plan especially as it incorporates all channels.

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
Would be nice if there was an automatic throttling of emails beyond what is currently in place... so if I send out a large batch of emails there would be a Sending system that would show me the best practice approach... E.g. the address book needs to be split into batches of x,xxx and will take xx number of days to complete... at which point I can click OK to proceed with this approach or tweak either option (split or days) which will in turn adjust the other.  The system will split the address book on the back end and send the emails according to the automation and send approach. It will also warn you if there is already an email send taking place and offer you the ability to adjust that existing send to accommodate the new one.

Recommendations to others considering Dotdigital:
Friendly team, willing to meet your needs. Easy to use... everything at your fingertips

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
It allows All team members the ability to communicate with customers easily and quickly. No need to wait on the resident "expert" to get things done. This regular communication has improved our relationship with the customer and their knowledge of the product.

all_reviews.review_title: I've had a great experience with the Engagement Cloud so far
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dotdigital?
1. The interfact. It's easy to find your way around the platform; whether you're building emails, looking for campaign reports, building surveys or managing programs.
2. The immediate support. It's been great to use the live chat feature when I get stuck with a problem. I've generally found the support staff to be very helpful and extremely fast in their response time.
3. The wider support. We've had fantastic help with various projects, such as updating our email templates and building custom survey forms.
4. The expanded features. The survey tool has been very useful for us, especially as we can integrate it with programs for an automated user experience. While we haven't experimented with the options with SMS and Google Ads, I am impressed with the expanding features and benefits.

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
The only main downside is the logging in security checks - we've had quite a few occassions where members of our team have had to sign in multiple times despite verifying their browser. Generally this seems ok, but it has caused us some issues in the past.

It's also a shame that there isn't an option to add dynamic content to plain-text emails - could this be something that is developed?

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
We were able to use the surveys with programs to automate our feedback surveys for courses we run. Before participants would have to fill in a long paper form, and then a member of our team would have to manually send out their attendance certificate. Now, participants fill in a dot digital form, submit their feedback, and instantly get a certificate sent to their email (the design of which was put together for us by the dot digital team).

Generally, the engagement cloud is helping us to automate many manual processes.

all_reviews.review_title: Dot Digital has helped us make vast improvements to our email marketing campaigns.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dotdigital?
Firstly the team at Dot Digital were fantastic throughout the on-boarding process and the training provided was incredibly thorough and enjoyable, so that was a great start. We really like the structure of setting up child accounts, the ease and customisation available in the template builder, and the detailed analysis we can get from the reporting suite.

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
We would really like to see some branding improvements in the surveys and forms tool.

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
In comparison to our previous platform, implementing Engagement Cloud has transformed our email marketing campaigns in several ways, including the flexibility of templates, how our emails look and respond across different devices, branding, and most importantly open and click rates. In addition the ability to have several child accounts and custom domains is great when several departments are using the platform. Finally the reporting tools give us a much more detailed view of performance.

all_reviews.review_title: dotdigital review
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dotdigital?
This tool can be used easily by those who haven't used an email tool such as this before. it is easy to build emails with drag and drop style building blocks.

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
The tool is very basic and you are charged extra for every little feature.
When new permissions are rolled out, they set all users to have access to the new permissions by default, and don't make you aware of this. It would be better if they set only the admins to having the new permissions by default.

Recommendations to others considering Dotdigital:
this is a very basic system. if you have new users that aren't familiar with this type of tool, it's a good starting point. they do charge extra for added features, and sold our company features they didn't need, so be sure to check you will need all features before purchasing anything. you can always add to your contract at a later date if needed.

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
To send marketing emails from one system, not many systems.
All data is stored in one place.
Email personlisation.

all_reviews.review_title: A good email marketing solution for non integrated CRMs
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dotdigital?
The ability to create address books, the global suppression lists, the email marketing templates and "easy editor", the programming and automation services, ability to add large number of data lists. Excellent customer support and relatively good price for scale.

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
There are occasional bugs with the easy editor and the opt-in system/preference center is hard to get set up without a lot of investment. If you need to require approval for an email to be sent, only the account holder can do so, which isn't great for larger organisations.

Recommendations to others considering Dotdigital:
Make sure you can accurately predict the amount of emails you will be sending as this will have a great affect on cost. Also speak to your account services manager on additional services you can implement, it's a powerful tool that can get a lot better when used correctly.

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
It's been a good benefit to our work especially for GDPR. As we have a non integrated CRM, suppressions are of paramount importance and we can rely on Dotdigital to do quite a bit of the work. I have also been able to democratize email creation through the sign off process available.

all_reviews.review_content:

The platform has a very powerful e-marketing automation platform built in, with a clear and user friendly user interface. The online campaign editor is also intuitive, enabling rapid campaign builds, with the possibility for a high degree of personalisation via customised contact segments.

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
It is hard to think of any major downsides to the platform. The online form builder has been an area of weakness, which had limited customisation, but as of Summer 2019 this has been replaced. I would like to see additional customisation and layout options built into the Surveys, with more complex branching logic.

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
Dotdigital Engagement Cloud enables all our email marketing and has helped us to grow our marketable database many-fold over the last 3 years. The automation functionality underpins one of our key online services in terms of managing the communications lifecycle.

all_reviews.review_title: Easy and powerful tool for marketing automation
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dotdigital?
Building a great looking campaign or a landing page has never been easier. Plus the customer support is really good!

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
The integration with Salesforce.com should be improved.

Recommendations to others considering Dotdigital:
Ask dotdigital for help to train the admins/key users. We have used the "train the trainer" approach and it worked great. We've been able to train over 100 users in less than 3 months and all of them were able to start using dotdigital right after the training.

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
Automation has simplified the process of organizing events and trainings at our company. We no longer need an extra person to collect the registrations and send out the confirmation. We could also reduce the budget for print materials - as it turned out most of our customers prefer emails.

Being able to segment audiences by almost ANY action (or non-action)
Select audiences visually through the mapping tool
Great customer chat who manages to resolve 95% of my queries first time

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
There has been a change which now charges based on number of contacts as well as email sends. This has increased the price overall.

Powerful system which easily handles segmentation, personalisation and automated triggers.

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
The platform is new to the company, so currently it is providing a customer journey for new customers. In the next phase of development, we will introduce automatic triggered emails to help improve overall conversion.

all_reviews.review_content:

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
It would be useful if we had more flexibility for choosing the age at which insight data is automatically deleted, as the jump from 2 to 4 years is quite big.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dotdigital?
Like how easy it is to use, and it is possible to create an EDM just from Easy Editor.  Also extremely helpful support team and account managers.

Functionality wise, very well thought on segmentation rules.  The dashboard identifying customer groups is useful.

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
Platform sometimes can be a bit slow (e.g. copying campaigns); some extra functionality would be expected (eg. throttling send after A/B split test); would hope that media manager can be more user-friendly.

Would appreciate a larger freedom to edit HTML on EDM campaigns.

Recommendations to others considering Dotdigital:
Perfect for starters.  Excellent support, professional strategists.

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
EDM campaign sends.  Segmentation rules are easy to set up, a lot of data fields are available for this purpose.  Also Geo segment and dynamic content.

all_reviews.review_title: Generally Pretty Good
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dotdigital?
The support has generally been very good, especially more recently. You have created a powerful tool that allows us to run our business more efficiently and effectively. The constantly evolving suite of features keeps the dotdigital community engaged and continues to add value to the product.

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
Having come from Mailchimp, the dotdigital GUI is clunky in comparison. The "Easy Editor" seems buggy, with inconsistencies in what can and can't be edited in different building blocks. It is frustrating that you need to click into each campaign report to view the revenue generated against that campaign - ideally, the campaign reports section should display revenue generated from the campaigns in the overview grid. SMS campaigns should be able to be sent in the exact same fashion as the email campaigns and provide the same level of reporting.

Recommendations to others considering Dotdigital:
Ensure you have the resources to dedicate time to the service. It is complicated but powerful and deserves resources to get the most from it.

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
The original move to dotdigital was to get Abandoned Carts working as they did not work well with Mailchimp. Abandoned Carts are now set up, having said that, looks like we launched abandoned carts in Oct 2017 and haven't generated as much revenue as I would have expected in those 2 years. The ability to create automations has helped enable us to create more meaningful connections with our customers.

Easy segmentation of contacts and address books means there is minimal fuss in arranging sends. Our account manager also handled our initial send outs, ensuring that we weren't going to be blacklisted by any domains. This was managed ti

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
The Magento 1 and 2 integrations aren't perfect, we've had issues with data syncing that we've never really resolved. We have managed to get around some of these issues by manually importing data, or workflows that would otherwise be handled by the platform.

Recommendations to others considering Dotdigital:
I would definitely recommend looking into DotDigital and finding out if it is for you, the pricing is fair and possible better than the market for similar systems, we've ran into no issues that have given us a negative experience that we haven't been able to resolve with support.

Automation of campaigns has become much easier in DotDigital, as well as being able to create responsive emails that don't break on different devices, we've had issues with this exact problem on most of the lower tier options that we explored, so this was a big deal to us when it worked out of the box.

all_reviews.review_title: Dotmailer - making customer communication a dream!
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dotdigital?
The main reason I like using Dotdigital is that it integrates perfectly to the ticketing database system I use (Spektrix) and the streamlined service between the two makes day-to-day marketing jobs a breeze. With Dotdigital you can build and create templates (perfect, don't have to create them each time - huge timesaver!) and it links to my pre-existing customer databases meaning I can easily select who I want to receive what e-mail. The design process is also really simple to use.

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
I dislike some of the limitations within the designs, I'd love to be able to get more creative with it and sometimes the design completely loses it's shape for no reason partway through creating it - with all of the individual blocks starting to stretch and no longer inline with each other. This can be infuriating but the benefits far outway the negatives.

Recommendations to others considering Dotdigital:
Fantastic service to use, if you're looking to improve your marketing activities and engage with new and existing customers in an easy way for yourself and the customers - this is the product for you.

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
Dotmailer has made communicating with customers super simple and effective, giving me the freedom to create a number of different e-news with ease and a professional look and feel. Since starting to learn more about the automation process, Dotdigital is about to launch my marketing campaigns to the next level giving quicker communication to new and existing customers PLUS saving me even more time as the automation programmes will just continue to run for me - perfect in the busy day of a marketing manager.

all_reviews.review_title: Pretty Great, but Has It's Faults
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dotdigital?
I went from using MailChimp to using dotmailer. I was thrilled with the basic construction of emails and managing contacts. The fact that I could make blocks with different numbers of columns on the fly had me in love. It is very easy to construct an email and send it out. It took some time to get our automation set up but once they were up and running it has been great.

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
If there's one major piece that I wish was there was an auto save. Like most people I have to multitask almost all the time and it takes time to construct an email. Often times if I get a phone call, urgent email or another task thrown at me I have to drop what I was previously doing. This comes back to haunt me in dotmailer because there is not auto save, but there is an auto log off. If I go back to my tab with my email being constructed and click on pretty much anything after its timed out then I have to hit refresh and proceed to losing everything since my last save. I have adjusted my workflow to account for this, but I loved in MailChimp that I could just close out of a window and not have to worry about losing where I was.

Recommendations to others considering Dotdigital:
It was a significant jump in cost to move from MailChimp to dotmailer, but it is a vastly superior product if you use it to its capacity.

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
What brought us to using dotmailer was the need for an abandoned cart program. We know we were losing potential revenue by not being able to convert people that had left product(s) in their cart. We also were feeling handcuffed by MailChimp's capabilities. Now we have abandoned cart and five other automation all running and we are seeing an overall improvement in our email-based revenue.

all_reviews.review_title: Disconnected organization makes it hard to built campaigns
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dotdigital?
I like the variety of landing page templates and the drag-and-drop user interface.

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
It is very difficult to connect campaigns, making me think this platform is better for beginners but not as robust as Hubspot or something similar. To set up a single gated offer campaign, I have to separately create a landing page, survey (form), address book, and program. This leads to further problems when reporting - a "campaign" only applies to emails, and does not include overall metrics of everything that may be connected in a content campaign. This is the most manual way to do automated marketing I have encountered in a single system. Unfortunate.

Recommendations to others considering Dotdigital:
If you are a beginner to marketing automation, or only need one tool primarily and others are a bonus, this could work for you. If you are experienced at creating automated, connected campaigns, try something like Hubspot or Salesforce Marketing Cloud.

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
We started using dotmailer with the hope that it would help us streamline marketing campaign creation and connectivity. While we are able to automate campaigns, the steps required to create all the elements separately and make sure they are connected takes a lot of time. The inability to identify all of the elements of a campaign as such (a landing page, email campaign, survey, etc are all set up separately) causes problems with tracking and reporting.

all_reviews.review_title: Nice changes overall
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dotdigital?
I like the fact we are now integrated with MSCRM and can see interactions and info on each email we send within the MSCRM application. Being able to create workflows based on interactions means Sales can review what customers are doing in real time. Which is important to Marketing.

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
The total number of our database uploaded to Dotmailer can not easily be modified to remove opt-outs and add new clients to replace those older opt-out ones with. Seems like it should be an easier process for that. As anyone knows, a good company will have an ever growing database.

Recommendations to others considering Dotdigital:
Think about your current email platform. Ask for demo's of things you MUST have, and ask all the deep questions that you may need answered before you move forward.

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
Interactions in MSCRM. IP protection, opt-out options. etc...

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?

We needed a email platform that would integrate with our ecommerce platform and this one fit the bill.  Adopting dotmailer was the spark we needed to start implementing a more robust direct-to-consumer email program and we've seen a huge increase in email conversations.

all_reviews.review_title: One Step Above Mailchimp
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dotdigital?
It's pretty easy to set up emails, save headers, footers and elements you want to reuse for drag-and-drop in later campaigns, and to set up new contact data fields, segments, and triggered email paths. It's also easy to incorporate Nosto for product recommendations and set up resends to segments beforehand.

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
Despite their Magento extension, it was not the easiest implementation, especially with pulling in products for Abandoned Cart. We wanted the product grid to be styled a specific way and not the generic grid which didn't look very nice and our developers had to do this in a specific file on the backend - not something we could have done ourselves as marketers. Also, the extension with Magento is not an API, so the data you can send back to Dotmailer is limited to what they had set up in the extension. If you want to track what page your subscribers are coming from (footer vs. specific landing page) or send additional data points (language preference/profiling consent), you can't because Dotmailer simply won't pull additional information. Shockingly, there's no easy way to track number of New Subscribers - only New Contacts, which is not the same as Subscribers because all Magento customers flow into Dotmailer, so it's counting all customer emails and not people who actively Subscribed. Not sure why an ESP wouldn't have this as a KPI. We've spoken with Support and our PM and no one has been able to provide a solution, so we have not been able to track Subscriber rate/Churn rate, which is ridiculous. Our designer also found the email builder to have default padding and there's no way to change the default, so it has to be removed every single time, which is annoying. If you click into Contacts, by default, it doesn't land on ALL Address Books for whatever reason, but some subcategory folder, which has no address books, so it's an extra click to ALL to see all address books. Then if you click into any of the books, then click back, it lands you back in the default folder, and not the page you were on previously, so it's just an extra step every time that makes it feel quite convoluted. There are several other non-intuitive elements that are similarly annoying.

Recommendations to others considering Dotdigital:
It's a step above Mailchimp because at least triggered emails are managed in one place. Reporting is not great. It's priced per email - keep in mind this includes all your customers, so this list will grow very quickly.

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
The ESP we had previously was substandard, so Dotmailer enabled us to do basic ESP things like build an email in the platform vs. inserting HTML, triggered programs, set up resends easily, set up segments easily. Being able to more easily resend and target segments has generated increase in email revenue.

all_reviews.review_title: A really great option for managing your email marketing
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dotdigital?
The visual interface for Dotmailer is really helpful and intuitive. The WYSIWYG email editor is easily the best feature. Coming from Mailchimp previously,  assembling our emails is SO much easier now. We save a lot more time with this feature as well!

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
I will say what I dislike about Dotmailer, is something that Mailchimp has and Dotmailer does not. Mailchimp has the ability to see the visual email and the html side-by-side. Although we normally don't need to see the code now that we are using Dotmailer, there have been a few instances where we needed to tweak HTML and CSS, and it was a little annoying having to flip back and forth to the design and code.

Recommendations to others considering Dotdigital:
If you are tired of coding your emails every single time and would love a visual drag-and-drop email builder, this is the tool for you :)

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
We are trying to better manage our email marketing, and hopefully segment our lists more by interests. We are just ramping up some of our various user lists, but we are really excited for the future potential of being able to market very specific messages to our various audiences!

all_reviews.review_title: Review of DM from a new user.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dotdigital?
I love the ease of use in designing templates. I enjoy the features that help me target my customers - they are powerful and intuitive. Specifically love how it syncs with Magento and Google analytics. Love the support team and customer service - especially valuable being that I am new to Dot Mailer and coming from a much less powerful platform.

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
I really dislike that contacts can be difficult to upload when not given to me via a CSV or XL. We do not use Sales Force, and DM doesn't integrate with our internal systems so often my reps send me a list of email names (from our internal systems) and I have no ability to add them without converting to a spreadsheet (extra step and not always easy) or I have to separate them out and do it one email address at a time. Even Constant Contact lets me cut and paste a list of emails at once. I also find it frustrating that I can't seem to add a new contact to multiple address books easily. This may be my own issue, but I can not seem to find a way to do this quickly. I also struggle with sharing temples and campaigns between child accounts and often when I save to "My Building Blocks" and go to use them later it is not saved. I wish it would flag me before hand, so I don't bother to save a block that I can't access later anyway. Some of the training videos are not applicable to me, as my account is set up differently and the alternative (learning via step-by-step written instructions) is time consuming and antiquated. I am new to this platform and often find myself not having the time to learn all of the wonderful features because the learning curve is steep.O

Recommendations to others considering Dotdigital:
Try it you'll like it!

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
Our companies were lagging behind the curve by years, being new to the e-commerce and email marketing game. We went from -0 to 100 overnight with DM. We have been able to segment for the first time and thought the wheel is moving slowly from our end, it is really night and day the data we have on our accounts and the way we communicate with them.

all_reviews.review_title: Comprehensive ESP: More than we need!
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dotdigital?
Dotmailer has so much to offer - I love the automation and segmentation capabilities, though I don't fully know how or have time to maximize them.  I also love the easy form creator and landing page functionality. It makes running campaigns and special promos easy.

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
I feel I didn't get enough training, so I don't know how to use many of the features offered. I also find the whole program creation a bit intimidating - all of the tools require serious logic. It would be nice to have some templates built in to go off of. I also don't find the reporting to be super helpful / in depth.

Recommendations to others considering Dotdigital:

all_reviews.review_title: Simple email builder with so-so UX
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dotdigital?
I primarily just use the email builder portion of the platform. I like that reporting is easy to view and dropping in external codes (i.e. dynamic blocks from 3rd party platforms) is simple. The tools in general for email builder is simple and easy to learn.

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
The general UX for the email builder is poorly designed and I notice consistent bugs. Drag and drop in email builder is glitchy and I often accidentally replace blocks with the wrong image from the library because there is significant lag when scrolling within the gallery -- it randomly jumps. Emails sent through Dotmailer display off-center when viewed through the gmail app, which is a significant bug that has never been rectified. The system of folders and images is too nested, could be easier and quicker to navigate. Thumbnails, especially in the templates section, do not update quickly or at all. Truncated titles of jpegs in the image library dont expand or preview, making longer names difficult to tell apart.

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
Our data is all in one place now and it is a large improvement over our last ESP, Marketraq.

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
It is a little hard for people with little to no background knowledge of computers or coding to get started but same as Magento.  Takes a bit of a learning curve and with the help of an outside developer, we were able to get things working.

Not sure at the moment.

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
Missing out on potential sales from interested customers.  We have a lot of customers who visit our website but don't purchase so we are trying to capitalize on that.  Also, being able to segment and target emails to for specific categories will help us with our conversions through email marketing.

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
We have a lot of different lists and it wasn't always clear other clients were delivering our emails effectively. Dotmailer makes it easier to ensure that everyone in our lists are getting the message the way we intended.

all_reviews.review_title: Good email marketing platform for a reasonable price
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dotdigital?
Full-featured email platform at a cost lower than most competitors.

UI is straightforward and functional, relatively fast.  I don't have much trouble finding what I'm looking for.

Onboarding, knowledge base, and technical support meant I learned the platform pretty quickly.  Technical support has always replied quickly and is usually helpful.

Program builder for triggered emails is easy to use, and powerful.

Segmentation tool works well.

Able to template and send all our transactional emails at no additional cost.

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
Reporting could be improved.  We can't figure out how to link to our Google Analytics account.

Easyeditor for emails is OK.  Would prefer something more robust with more even more features.

Sometimes pages load slow through the UI.

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
Succesful marketing campaign emails.

Personalized trigger emails.

Templated transactional emails.

The drag and drop email editor tool is a must-have for any our marketing team.

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
Since Dotmailer is relying on share send servers, their security for spam is quite high. We had a few problem re-subscribing customers that unsubscribed but were unable to resubscribe.

If you except a huge growth of your email list, make sure you analyze pricing as it will increase with your email list size.

Recommendations to others considering Dotdigital:

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
Saving in cost compared to previous email platform.
Ease of use for our team, resulting in more features being used compared to previous email platform.
Native integration with Magento 2.

all_reviews.review_title: New Customer
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dotdigital?
Tighter integration with Magento. Ability to have automations. Surveys & Texting ability. We are currently under utilizing a lot of the features of Dotmailer as we are ramping up our familiarization with the platform.

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
WYSWYG interface is cumbersome and a bit more unintuitive coming from MailChimp.
Can't filter/search for contacts only by domain. (ex: all gmail users)
Support/Help documentation is pretty lacking when it comes to Magento specific steps. Ex: how to use promo-codes correctly.
Can't preview what an email looks with any kind of Dynamic or External content blocks without sending it (sending as a test doesn't work) which is very frustrating.

Recommendations to others considering Dotdigital:
Understand the weaknesses with Magento 2 integration. Ex: While Dotmailer has abandoned cart email functionality, with Magento 2 the UX is not customizable despite their non-M2 implementation having the ability to customize.

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
While we do not have all features turned on yet we're looking to solve the following issues:
Understand purchase revenue generated from each email sent.
Be able to dynamically insert "best sellers" or "you may like" based on customer history
Abandoned cart emails
New customer / Re-engagement automations

all_reviews.review_title: It's Good, But Have a Lot of Nickels and Dimes
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dotdigital?
I love that it's directly integrated with Magento. They also have competent support available by phone, live chat, or tickets.

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
Billing. They limit the data you provide and then charge overages for what you sync over those limits. We pretty much only sync our subscribers and catalog and not our guest or customers. This limits its value as we can't utilize some of all of the benefits.

Recommendations to others considering Dotdigital:
It takes a lot of setup, and you have to manage it. It's not something worth paying for if you aren't going to commit to it, and it won't work either. If you have the time and knowledge. they'll help you the rest of the way with they're great support.

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
Email marketing by campaigns, abandoned carts and welcome program for subscribers.
