all_reviews.review_title: Unsubscribe lists now useless to us
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dotdigital?
Templates look good and work well.  Using through third party TT Mail, but always good customer service.

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
That you can no longer export the full details (i.e. donor number) of your own donor, which you uploaded in the first place, once they unsubscribe.  We now cannot put the file back into our database to update GDPR preferences, without manually having to add the donor number back in.

Recommendations to others considering Dotdigital:
Consider if your database can match on email address, otherwise you won't be able to automatically upload unsubscribe lists to update donor preferences.  Very frustrating since this has been possible for the 10+ years we've used TT Mail, but was withdrawn due to misinterpretation of the new GDPR regs.

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
We've used DotMailer for years, through charity intermediary TT Mail.  It has been excellent, until a recent 'improvement', justified by some 'interesting'interpretation of the new GDPR regs, means that when we generate an unsubscribed list, the exported file no longer contains our donor number.  Since we input the donor number and other info ourselves and are obviously only doing so with donors who have a clear email opt-in, this seems ridiculous.  Our charity database need to match back on donor number and so now, we are having to do it manually.  DotMailer seem unable or unwilling to resolve this, so we are now being forced to find an alternative email solution.

The interface design is clean and organized making it easy to find what you're looking for. The drag and drop feature when building an email is easy to use compared to bronto and offers more features!

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
Would like to be able to choose a group to send to while at the same time choosing another group to not send to so that any overlapping emails would not get the email.

Recommendations to others considering Dotdigital:
They offered us a month trial to get in and look at all the things they offer in there so I think that was the most helpful in deciding whether or not to switch from Bronto. You can definitely see you get more at a better price.

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
There is a lot more additional features other email marketing tools don't have I like that we have the option to send out SMS and can make emails that show related products to ones people have used in the past.

all_reviews.review_title: Dotmailer makes life easier
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dotdigital?
There are so many things to like beat about dotmailer. The user interface is classically deaigned and simple to use. Building email
campaigns is as simple as drag and drop with custom built templates or templates that you create on your own.

Not a designer? Not a problem! The entire system is built off anyone being able to use it. Don't mistake the simplicity of using the platform for a lack of features. Address books, segments and customer scores make it a one stop tool for brand building, transactional and ecommerce
Marketing through email.

Even better than the platform is the customer service. Each individual at dotmailer treats the customer with the highest respect.

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
Automation programs can be a bit stronger and beefing up the reporting to make sure that the programs are firing as designed.

Recommendations to others considering Dotdigital:
I would strongly recommend dotmailer to other users. Not a perfect product but the customer service and technical teams listen and genuinely care about making it better for each user.

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
We utilize dotmailer to trigger our ecommerce transactional emails through Magento. This provided a much higher delivery success rate and allows us to track each email through the clients.

all_reviews.review_title: A complete suite for e-mail marketing and more
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dotdigital?
Dotmailer has the best WYSIWYG email editor on the market. It is extremely flexible, it allows creating complex layouts on emails without sacrificing client cross-compatibility too much. The automation tool is robust and easy to use. The segmentation functionality is very flexible and allows implementing very specific rules for creating segments.

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
Somewhat clunky interface that could use a little refreshment. Contact uploading is a little hard. The reporting tools have room for improvement, especially on the exporting side.

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
We run continent-wide email communications in multiple languages for millions of people. The ease of use and rich set of functionality that Dotmailer brings enables us build and send communications in matter of hours, a key ability in an industry as fast-moving as airlines.
The sophisticated automation tools have helped us create a robust set of automated customer interactions via email, based on transactional data collected from various sources, allowing us to sell more and improve our relations with our customers.

all_reviews.review_title: Enterprise Platform at SMB Cost
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dotdigital?
As a Magento partner, we like that dotmailer is now integrated with Magento's core. The segmentation abilities with Magento has helped our customers grow their site revenue considerably with less effort than managing an entry level ESP.

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
I have heard from some of our customers that the sales process has been very pushy.  Sometimes the sales reps need to take it easy but I know they are under pressure to hit numbers just like any Enterprise SaaS company.

Recommendations to others considering Dotdigital:
Dotmailer has essentially all of the features/functionality/service that other platforms provide but they are the most competitive on price.

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
Definitely providing a solution for more accurate and targeted emails. Segmentation is key.

all_reviews.review_title: DotMailer is a great platform if you want a easy-to-integrate and supported email platform
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dotdigital?
The support group is amazing at Dotmailer - happy to help you with your integration. I hopped on calls often for help from the dotmailer team, talking about anything from list importing to email best practices. Support is excellent. Also, the integration with Magento is solid and customizable - we had ample customizations tha really helped us deliver the best marketing we could.

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
The UI/UX is a bit old and outdated, and can be slightly confusing, compared to other platforms. The UI can also be confusing, with contradictory Calls to Action. Another thing to keep in mind is that the platform seems to be based and built in the UX, meaning the language can be a tad different than if you're located in the US. Other email platforms have better User Experience hands down.

Also, there are far less integrations than other email tools like Mailchimp. This really hindered our ability to fully integrate across our platforms.

Recommendations to others considering Dotdigital:
Dotmailer is a great platform for those who want customizability, as well as AI-powered functionality. However, per-user it can be more expensive than other solutions, like MailChimp - the cost for us wasn't worth it.

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
We needed an email platform that was highly customizable and integrated well with MailChimp. At the time, there weren't many that worked extremely well. Dotmailer's Magento integration was excellent.

We wanted to market to our  many interested consumers, with a list size in the hundreds of thousands.

all_reviews.review_title: Easy to use with great support
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dotdigital?
The email editor with the built-in templates just makes life so much easier, flexible segmentation builders, easy to use automation and good reporting tools. The onboarding team was really helpful especially with our Magento set up and training. The customer service for me is a huge selling point of the platform. Having multiple support members on live chat is essential for ensuring you don't miss your deadlines. A response is instant and bugs are once in a blue moon. Honestly, I couldn't recommend it enough.

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
There are a few things like; it would be lovely to exclude segments (as you can for the time being only do so with address books) and it would be nice to be more specific on some of the automation segmentations but seriously, I've used a couple of different ESP's and you know what I can live with this. DM constantly updates and improves the platform with correct testing and planning involved so there is little to no downtime for the users. The positives outweigh the negatives always!

Recommendations to others considering Dotdigital:
I'd recommend considering dotmailer particularly to small teams, where a fast overturn of campaigns are needed and quickly. The ease of putting together campaigns quickly, testing and being able to automate makes email marketing so much easier.

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
Better segmentation than our previous ESP which resulted in higher conversion and engagement rates. The ability to quickly put together campaigns with the ease of the editor and quickly look at report overviews to understand what worked and what didn't.

all_reviews.review_title: Dotmailer: Not very user-friendly, but does the job
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dotdigital?
Once you get used to using this platform for creating emails, it's not too bad. They turn out quite appealing for targeted audiences. I love the feature where you can see metrics of who's seen the email, how many people unsubscribed, and ROI. This data is useful for our organization for future emails. It's very customizable and you can make it look however you want.

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
When I first started using Dotmailer, it was very confusing. You basically learn by clicking around everywhere and figuring out where all the functions are. The emails I create now look much better than the ones I made 6 months ago. One of my least favorite things about Dotmailer is the LAG. There is so much lag on the site, and it also doesn't autosave. The other day, I spent a lot of time on an email but never hit "Save". When I lost internet and refreshed the page, I lost everything I had worked on... Also, the overall layout is just not very advanced and certain features are hidden deep within the settings.

Recommendations to others considering Dotdigital:
Maybe invest in a more advanced version. The one I use it very slow and laggy

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
We use Dotmailer for weekly emails to our mentors, for fundraising outreach, and for Board communications

The many valuable webinars and seminars keeps me on top of trends and the continuously changing industry. I don't know what I would do without them.

review_question_answers.answer: Increased revenue and site visits. Productivity has increased due to the ease of use. We are also able to engage and convert lapsed customers.

all_reviews.review_title: Highly Recommend
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dotdigital?
We made the switch from ExactTarget to Dotmailer and never looked back! With the seamless Magento integration and easy editor tool for laying out emails, we find the system very easy to use and helping us to make great strides in our email marketing efforts. On top of that, the cost is extremely fair and the support team and account managers are really great. They truly want to help your business succeed in email marketing and go above and beyond to make that happen!

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
A few wonkly features like having to do preheaders as white text in the email body and not being able to easily do exclusions during the send. The reporting is good but I wish it was a bit more robust.

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
We switched from ExactTarget which was going to cost thousands of dollars to integrate with Magento. Dotmailer offers a seamless integration with tons of automation options.

all_reviews.review_title: Great UI - Easy to use and navigate
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dotdigital?
Building complex email campaigns are really simple - you can drag and drop your required fields and easily get started!

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
It would be great if the information is synced back to the lead/contact records in Salesforce.

Recommendations to others considering Dotdigital:
With a lot of email marketing and marketing automation systems out there - make sure that you carefully evaluate exactly what features that you need. If you have a marketing team that is not so technically minded - putting Dotmailer in place gives you a really simple way to build/create email marketing collateral such as landing pages, forms and surveys and more complex email campaigns that will help you to track and measure your prospect's behaviours. In comparison to a lot of other solutions, it is also more cost-effective.

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
The landing page builder makes it really easy to build nicely designed landing pages that helps our lead generation campaigns.

all_reviews.review_title: User Friendly Sophistication
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dotdigital?
The dotmailer platform uniquely provides the ease of use without being at the expense of sophistication. Being able to personalization, dynamic content, and more complex segmentation is learned intuitively.

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
It would be beneficial to have a calendar showing previous and future sends. Being able to hover over a send on a calendar with rudimentary segment and campaign info gives a over view which is less helpful in list form.

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
The intuitive ability for creating and repeat use of campaign design with the use of dynamic content and personalization. This ability has increased unique opens and client engagement. The control and intricacy of  building segments is very logical. This allows us to better target customers based on highly specific product, geo, and historical data.

all_reviews.review_title: Dotmailer for small business
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dotdigital?
the ease of using, setting up templates, and keeping things up to date. I also love the settings we have to read followup on our emails sent.

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
I think it is pricey for what you get. i totally get the initial startup costs but I'm curious why the cost continues to stay high when so little is done by the DM team once set up

Recommendations to others considering Dotdigital:
-once you get past the initial setup, its easy to use
-the chat help function is always helpful and willing to work with you on specific questions
-don't be afraid to create more than one template. you can copy and edit it yourself with ease
-copy and paste email campaigns if you want them to be similar; way less time consuming
-make your own building blocks. it took me way to long to realize how easy they were to create and use.

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
We are working on mass mailers and sharing specials.
i like the ease of creating specific groups/segments to target

all_reviews.review_title: Simple, flexible and good breadth of features/functionalities
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dotdigital?
It's simple to use but has a lot of features. Campaigns can be set up in a matter of minutes and each campaign can be analysed in detail.

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
The questionnaire functionality does not allow for pre-population of fields within questions from a file or from previous responses within the same questionnaire. This means that the respondent might have to go back to the email or go by memory when you want to ask about individualized detail.

Recommendations to others considering Dotdigital:
If you send campaigns regularly to different types of audiences with different types of content, you should use naming conventions for your campaigns that allows you to group them quickly in the campaign report export. Otherwise you will spend a day and a half trying sorting the apples from the oranges in a massive spreadsheet.

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
Easy branding of communications and the ability to analyse conversion rates. We have been able to improve open rates and operational turnaround time.

all_reviews.review_title: Automation Made Simple
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dotdigital?
The best feature offered by Dotmailer is Email Automation Programs. My organization was able to set up a Welcome email series for donors. We had never created anything like it before, and already the results are astounding.

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
The feature I dislike is the integration aspect. We've been working for a long time to get Salesforce reporting to connect with Dotmailer address books. Since this integration piece isn't already offered, we must create it ourselves.

Recommendations to others considering Dotdigital:
I would recommend users thoroughly look into the options Dotmailer can offer their organization. The drag-and-drop editor, automation, and address books features are a compelling reason to consider.

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
The benefits of having a new donor welcome series are too frequent to mention. We are seeing real feedback that is overwhelmingly positive. Our donors feel more connected to us, and subsequently, want to increase (even double!) their giving.

all_reviews.review_title: Good, intuitive drag and drop system
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dotdigital?
It's very easy to use - minimal training needed. I've found bugs needing coding fixes are few and far between. Quick and easy to drag and drop images and other files into emails. Easy and quick to build surveys.

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
A few actions aren't clear from the interface, which have required help from dotmailer.

Recommendations to others considering Dotdigital:
Check that the package you're going for includes any templates that you need from the outset, or there will be additional charges for this development work. I have encountered bugs with email templates but the support team have been excellent and have helped with this.

all_reviews.review_title: Relatively consistently good service with a few bugs
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dotdigital?
The interface is simple and easy to learn. Dotmailer provides a simple drag and drop tool for designing HTML email marketing campaigns. It is also very organized and easy to find your way around even with minimal knowledge of the product.

Dotmailer also has fantastic customer service. I have had issues in the past creating an email campaign, and Dotmailer's site features an instant messaging tool that puts you in touch with one of the customer services reps. These people are very friendly and helpful, which goes a long way. I never feel like I am up the creek without a paddle when I run into a problem.

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
Occasionally, Dotmailer will fail to send out requested test emails. I always send myself test emailers before I send them out to the actual client. There are times when I I will select to send out a test email, and the email will never show up in my inbox. This will happen with multiple tries.

Another issue is that you have to pay extra to test your emailers for spam (as in, whether or not it will be caught by a spam blocker). We have issues where some of our campaigns do not reach clients due to spam blockers. It would be great if this was included into the price of using the software, and not an extra charge.

Recommendations to others considering Dotdigital:
It is always important to check out other services before committing to one. My company uses Mailchimp, for example, which is better suited for internal communications.

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
E-marketing, which is the bulk of my companies marketing initiative. The benefits of using Dotmailer allow us

all_reviews.review_title: A good product, held back by their support team
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dotdigital?
Their 'easy editor' is simply amazing and above and beyond anything else on the market. Their segmentation tools are powerful and could not be easier to use. Their reseller tools are useful and perfect for agencies. Their automation tools are SO easy to pick up and use and the easiest to master on the market. Their roadmap is easily available and they bring a lot of decent updates regulary. Their key account team are the best in the business.

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
Their support team are horrendous and do not seem to know how to use the tool properly. Their sales and key account team consistently prove that they know more about the product than the support team do and they repeatedly state incorrect facts about the tool which just causes confusion. If the tool has any form of large outage, the communication is ridiculously poor and they have been in dire need of proper support management for years. It seems to be the only area where they do not grow their product.

Recommendations to others considering Dotdigital:
The budget is required to get the most out of dotmailer. The more you put in, the more you will get out. Work with the team to get the most out of them and ensure your know how to use the tool effectively to lesson your need for support.

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
We needed an easy to use, easy to setup and simple email tool for non technical users to pick up and master. Dotmailer offered this in spades, consitently turning standard or non technical users into marketing guru's thanks to its exceptionally initiative UI and design. The knowledge base is building and the easy editor allows users to become designers, which is a massive deal. The benefits have been incredible; giving a number of users a lot more tools and ability than they would over any other marketing tool on the market.

all_reviews.review_title: Gets the emails out, but not the easiest or most reliable tool available
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dotdigital?
I like that each email address counts as one contact no matter how many lists it's on. The ReMail option is a quick and easy way to follow up with nonopeners. The automation program designer is a good visual tool for mapping out communication plans.

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
The automation works decently, but it's not all the way there yet. It's difficult to tell if your program is functioning the way you want it to, and the triggers can be pretty limiting. The reporting is not great. Reports that should be easy to access are either nonexistent or difficult to find. We've also had some issues with the time difference between where we are and where the dotmailer team is based.

Recommendations to others considering Dotdigital:
If you're planning to do any sort of automation, test our your programs and compare dotmailer to the other more automation-focused marketing products.

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
We moved to dotmailer to send lots of emails to lots of people. We are able to send large quantities of emails quickly.

all_reviews.review_title: Reliable and clever, but tough reporting
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dotdigital?
I think that the tool has several interesting trigger, dynamic feed, and segmentation capabilities that make it ideal for marketers, and the one-to-one service we received from both Sophie Sherley-Dale and Jonny Dixon was extraordinary: their insights and approach were thoughtful and educated.


What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
We found the onboarding process with Dotmailer to be very challenging...they seem to have some issues with project management. Otherwise, software-wise, we just felt the automated reporting to be fairly rudimentary and not incredibly useful, and the reporting functions that we needed couldn't be met with customization. Also, the HTML functions within this solution are limited, so it's not great for development/customization.

Recommendations to others considering Dotdigital:
Ensure that all of your reporting needs are met at the segment (as opposed to campaign) level before signup. Sign up for service retainer hours, as I do believe that Dotmailer functions and serves best with constant attention from their account managers and strategists working with your internal team, as the tool can be somewhat counterintuitive or opaque when it comes to surfacing information or approaching specific automated actions.

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
Dotmailer has thought about some very useful and very turnkey solutions with Magento specifically.
We are trying to work to speak to customers over a nine-month pregnancy, which proved a bit challenging with the restrictions on number of actions with Dotmailer's automated campaign, but the ability to query and use customer information was strong.

all_reviews.review_title: Horrible Experience
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dotdigital?
Nuk our technical rep was pleasant to work with.

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
I signed an agreement with Dotmailer on May 20, 2015.   I met the Dotmailer sales rep at the Magento Imagine conference.  I was assured that the integration with Magento Enterprise was a simple integration with their Dotmailer extension.  I felt confident as Dotmailer is Magento Platinum partner that this would be the case.  During this time I reached out to them to make sure I wasn't going to be charged until it is up and running.  I was reassured that they would not charge me until it is running.  After more than three months of them trying to implement this on August 31st, we finally gave a week's notice to get it up and running.   Not only did they not get it up in a week it was still not up by the end of September.  In October they finally tell me it is working so I schedule a training to get it started.  Then that after more than 4 months of waiting that I would have to wait another 3 weeks for training.  On top of that they send me a bill for the last 4 months.  I really still don't know if i works or not.  Mind you during this time I did not hear from  a supervisor or manager.  I let them know that we would not continue with Dotmailer.  I finally hear from a manager who states there was no reason for a manager to get involved and threatened me with the agreement and when I asked him if he considered that acceptable he hung up on me.  Since then I have received numerous invoices and now calls from a collection agency.

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
Cart Abandonment, triggered/transactional emails, post purchase, etc.

all_reviews.review_title: dotmailer user for over 4 years
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dotdigital?
Drag and drop editor is time-saving and easy-to-use. The platform includes a set of advanced features, like A/B testing on subject line or content, personalization, a dynamic content builder, and segmentation tools that work on numerous data points and behaviors. The platform is very stable and navigation intuitive. Analytics are superb, with drill downs for in depth marketing analysis. Comparing one campaign to another or many campaigns against each other is easy to manage. Email client reports, hotspots, pdf reporting, all available.

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
dotmailer often rev's their platform. If you have created customized templates or procedures, be aware that a review of any customization every 6 months or so would capitalize on platform improvements. The toolset is a bit expensive, but is well worth the expense if you are a medium to large-sized business.

Recommendations to others considering Dotdigital:
Utilize the company's resources, as their knowledge base is comprehensive. The company is primarily based in the UK and therefore international. Enjoy dotmailer!

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
dotmailer providers a comprehensive set of tools: email marketing, automation, transactional marketing, surveys, landing pages. For a busy marketing department, the software platform can readily manage: signups, lead-gen, email broadcasts, automation, transactions, re-engagement, surveys and events. Drag and drop and HTML editors provide an interface for beginners or those with advanced skills. Email metrics monitor unsubscribes, opens, clicks, clicks-to-open rate, and bounces. Revenue and web traffic can also be monitored with some pretty simple javascripting adjustments.

Makes it very hard to develop custom HTML emails compatible with easy editor, documentation on the subject very old. The pre-built designs included with the platform look very dated, they seem to really want everyone to use their email customisation service.

Their back-end platform seems quite dated too and there are certain UX elements that just don't make sense. Their default templates also don't seem to follow the latest conventions in email design.

all_reviews.review_title: A killer admin loaded with features and tons of segmentation for pinpoint targeting.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dotdigital?
Migrating over from another large email platform, what really stands out with dotmailer are the segmentation and automation tools. Syncing customer and order data from Magento is seamless and provides powerful ammunition to the segmentation tools that work on these numerous data points and behaviors. This is all simplified by the super user-friendly campaign building tool, which includes a drag-and-drop interface and easy to use dynamic content blocks for dynamic personalized emails.

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
The only gripe so far that we've noticed is that with all of these user-friendly automated features, the manual tinkering of older platforms becomes a bit more buried. For example in order to use the dynamic content blocks feature, you must forego the ability to use custom HTML and are limited to the drag-and-drop interface. Not the end of the world, but definitely a trade-off there.

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
What this has solved the most for us, is helping us to change our tactics from blanket store-wide emails offering coupons (like an abandoned cart 5% message), into specific, targeted emails that only go to the users that need them. For example, a frequent shopper no longer received an immediate coupon, but someone who only makes purchases during promos we can now isolate and send only them a coupon, keeping ROI up and preventing unnecessary discounts and offers.

review_question_answers.question: What do you like best about Dotdigital?
review_question_answers.answer: Migrating over from another large email platform, what really stands out with dotmailer are the segmentation and automation tools. Syncing customer and order data from Magento is seamless and provides powerful ammunition to the segmentation tools that work on these numerous data points and behaviors. This is all simplified by the super user-friendly campaign building tool, which includes a drag-and-drop interface and easy to use dynamic content blocks for dynamic personalized emails.

review_question_answers.question: What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
review_question_answers.answer: The only gripe so far that we've noticed is that with all of these user-friendly automated features, the manual tinkering of older platforms becomes a bit more buried. For example in order to use the dynamic content blocks feature, you must forego the ability to use custom HTML and are limited to the drag-and-drop interface. Not the end of the world, but definitely a trade-off there.

all_reviews.review_title: Great software with a continuous inovative approach and user friendly for non-experts.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dotdigital?
dotMailer is continuously trying to add new services and features. They have a friendly staff who are well trained and always happy to help. I worked with dotMailer for several years now and was always been pleased with their service.

Their easy editor is very easy to use and is great for those who do not understand HTML code well.

Their reporting  tool is also really good and easy to use.

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
Their classic editor is very limited and it is not very easy to use. They seem to invest a lot of time and effort in their easy editor while classic editor could benefit from some improvements.

Recommendations to others considering Dotdigital:
If you are a marketer, are creating email campaigns for your organisation yourself and do not have an advanced HTML code knowledge and sometimes struggle to use classic HTML editor this is definitely the product for you. dotMailer's easy editor is extremely user friendly and their customer support is excellent (at least i found).
.
However, if you understand HTML code well and prefer classic editor than this is probably not a service provider for you as their classic editor is very limited and there are some better emailing packages out there.

I managed to find an email designer who was happy to explore the easy editor though and managed to create for me a professional looking template which is now very flexible though. Which means that for further campaigns I may only change headers and some images so almost like a plugg-ins reducing the cost significantly.

So I recommend to try their demo and evaluate if this is a package for you.

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
*

all_reviews.review_title: Not far off an excellent product
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dotdigital?
The easy editor is amazingly easy to use.  Drag and drop interface is great for everyone, and being able to save complex blocks for future use is a great feature and massively time saving.  Once we figured it out, uploading templates is also a cinch too.  The reporting is a good set for analysis, and Segments is a good, easy way to identify ideal target audiences through their behaviours.  The integration with CRM is great and makes target selection easy, with detailed analytics back into the heart of our business.  The support team are also amazing - Account Manager is helpful and the Product Integration Team couldn;t do more for me.  The dotSurvey and microsites are also really easy to use, the CopyKat being a great feature for quick, on-brand releases.

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
API Integration could do more in terms of the stats delivered back into CRM.  There's no analytics for Opens that gets dropped back into the CRM system, so if I need to query open AND click behaviours I can only do this in the web client.  There are more features that I'd love to see to take this great product to an excellent product, all in the vein of automation.  I'm looking into how this could be integrated through the API calls.  I also don't like the inbox test process, as this costs PS5 per go, but a direct contract with Litmus (the supplier) is not too far off that for a monthly fee.  We use our CRM system to hold our master subscription preferences, but we are not allowed to send the mailings without using the dotMailer standard http://$UNSUB$ link in our code, so we have to do our best to hide this.

Recommendations to others considering Dotdigital:
Stick with it.  The product team are very open to new ideas, so head over to the user support forums to submit suggestions for future developments.  It's a very capable and easy to use email distribution service, with detailed analytics off the back of it.  The integration into Dynamics CRM doesn't capture ALL the behaviour metrics available in the web client, but they ultimately want folk to use their product implicitly.  It carries a decent feature set, and is hinting towards automation - be mindful of this when making your tech selection, as it's not there yet.

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
Synchronisation with our Dynamics CRM installation is giving us excellent insight to our contacts' behaviour, and is driving change in our marketing strategy.

all_reviews.review_title: Great for small businesses that need a big reach
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dotdigital?
We have been using Dotmailer for a number of years and it suits us as we are a small company with a broad customer base. The reports available on the site are incredibly useful for pinpointing which parts of which campaigns have been most successful for us and with whom.

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
We have never been a great fan of the Easy Editor functionality, although I appreciate that we may be in a minority. We prefer to code our campaigns in a separate program and then import the whole thing into Dotmailer. We may lose some of the benefits of Easy Editor, but overall we have found our system to be simpler. We are lucky in that we have people in the office with coding experience, the Easy Editor may be particularly useful for people who don't have that familiarity with coding.

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
We have been able to use Dotmailer to test and identify popular trends with our clients. We have discovered that clients are particularly interested in specific parts of our product range, and have been able to focus more attention on developing and digitising those particular areas as a direct result.

all_reviews.review_title: Easy To Use Email Marketing System
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dotdigital?
Used Dotmailer for about 6 years and seen it change dramatically since first using it, especially the editor. Easy enough to use with drag and drop functions, good reporting, Lucy and staff from Dotmailer have always been helpful. Better than systems like Mail Chimp, in my opinion.

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
Not a system for hand coding as HTML editing is limited (this can be frustrating at times, trying to align elements etc). Doesn't work too well in Chrome as some functions do not work at all. So long as you save your templates regularly, then you wont have a problem, but if you spend hours editing, only for the Social Links to stop responding and wipes your template and work.... yes, that happened to me yesterday. A regular auto-save would be good. The Map Of Openers is pretty useless to me... would rather see a Google Map with the locations pin pointed on the map (something I have to do manually in Google Drive instead). Don't really like the set templates, as they seems a little old in design to me, so always had to create my own. Image editing could be better, otherwise have to do this externally. This might seem like a long list of gripes, but overall the system is the best i have used to date.

Recommendations to others considering Dotdigital:
Have looked at various other email systems in the past, but dotMailer beat them on functionality and price.

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
Email Marketing is an important part of our business and generates sales. As the decision and buying cycle of our business stretches into months, keeping our business prominent in peoples minds helps us gain business. So long as you don't bombard people with emails and tell them something they want to hear, then it works perfectly.

As the decision and buying cycle of our business stretches into months, keeping our business prominent in peoples minds helps us gain business. So long as you don't bombard people with emails and tell them something they want to hear, then it works perfectly.

all_reviews.review_title: Always looking to improve content and service
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dotdigital?
Having used Dotmailer for a number of years I'm always impressed that they look to improve what we do and it feels like they are working with our best interests in mind rather than their own which is unusual in this day and age.

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
I feel sometimes the software is a little restricting from a creativity point of view if we want to do something a little different but this is nit-picking really.

Recommendations to others considering Dotdigital:
Speak to them openly about what you want to achieve with your online activity and they will help shape a system which works for you and delivers the results you want.

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
It's safe to say that there are a lot of features in the Dotmailer system which we are still only scratching the surface of particularly when it comes to segmentation of our databases but it's good to know the systems are already in place when our internal teams are ready to take the next step.

all_reviews.review_title: Great Mailing System
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dotdigital?
The ease of the system and the in-depth reporting is the best part of dotMailer, it makes everything very simple and visual to evaluate.

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
Resending a particular campaign to new contacts within the same contact address list.  I have not found an easy way of doing this without creating a new address list which I would rather not due for my reporting stats.

Recommendations to others considering Dotdigital:
I think dotMailer is one of the easiest mailing systems I have used.  I would highly recommend training, even using dotMailer for the last 18 months there was functionality we had not utilised and a lot of little things that would drive more traffic and activity we had over looked.

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
We are now integrating dotMailer with SalesForce in the hope of automating a lot of functions we currently do manually.  We also are excited to see the sync function so our staff can see the clients activity history and contact the most interested clients first.

all_reviews.review_title: Pretty good investment depending on what you do and what you need
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dotdigital?
The integration with our Microsoft Dynamics CRM.   We used to have Mad Mimi (which is extremely good for the cost and is a very good basic emailing tool), but DotMailer integration allows customers to update mailing preferences and updates automatically on bounce-backs.
It is also extremely helpful that the CRM marketing lists are updated from our 60 users of CRM, which in turn updates DotMailer email lists - I don't have to worry about updating the database.
The feature i have benefited from the most is the ability to analyze DotMailer stats in our CRM system which allows us to cross reference data.
The DotSurvey and Microsite features are pretty good too, allowing online interaction with our customers.  We were originally using Survey Monkey which is a superior survey tool, but if you just need a basic survey tool, using DotSurvey means you don't have to keep importing up to date contact lists before each survey.

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
It's frustrating that integration isn't fully there yet.  We use an on premise in the cloud CRM with ADFS to populate users, and this was a nightmare to then add DotMailer into the mix.  Once past that, we found that our contact data could not sync both ways from the 2 systems - so we have users updating their own address details on forms through DotSurvey which doesn't update CRM.
Another area that needs significant work is the microsite capability - it's a really basic editor, which relies on html skills to avoid the page looking 'noddy'.  It also has a few bugs in it working in the browser.
We also haven't been able to exploit the feature that shows who has visited the web from email even though we have all the tracking cookies in place on the web.
The contract pricing structure is also a little irritating - if you choose to increase your package of monthly sends, your 2 year contract starts again from that new date.

Recommendations to others considering Dotdigital:
If you just need an email tool - Mad Mimi is significantly cheaper and free to set up plus their support is very good and there isn't much at all to go wrong. Price bracket is $30/mth for around 10k sends

DotMailer, for the same mailing numbers, sits at around PS270/mth which includes a dedicated CRM license but you get stung for the one of installation cost which is hefty, and we are at the top level package - all this allows full CRM integration.   What that offers is far superior in data analyse and management.
DotMailer like most software providers sell their package well - but beware, everything they demonstrate during the sales process is not all applicable to every variation of installation.   The ideal platform is their web interface.
The support is also reliant on help sheets, videos and online help questions.   And if like us, you are looking at the full integration - they have the bare bones of a support in this area (in the UK)

If you want more automation and your channels working harder to uncover sales leads, consider looking to invest more but avoid the license driven software options - they are extortionate.


What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
We decided to move from Mad Mimi to DotMailer to speed up processes and remove a lot of manual work - importing data back and forth.   It has absolutely served it's purpose and achieved that.
What it has also provided is the ability to re-mail non-openers, set up secondary emails based on actions of the first and my favourite - resend the original email again and again, but only sending to new contacts on the mailing list.
DotMailer has been in place for 2 years now, and we have realised that we need more integration again between the web and social channels and the ability to run the full campaign from beginning to end with better microsite facilities.  We are currently considering both Eloqua and Target360 software - the jury is out.

all_reviews.review_title: Dotmailer system
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dotdigital?
The features are so simple to use, especially the drag and drop design element. I always want my emails to look good and the library of templates are a great start for anyone who isn't fantastic at HTML themselves. I've used a number of email systems over the years and this by far is the easiest to navigate.

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
II would love for there to be a tablet version or app to easily edit my emails on the go.

Recommendations to others considering Dotdigital:
Use the trial and test the features for yourself. We also trialed the survey tool which wasn't of use to us. Everyone wants something different so always check the product first.

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
We are working on a lot of internal communications strategies, and dotmailer has helped me create consistent and sharp messaging that appeals to everyone and is easy to digest.

all_reviews.review_title: dotMailer has provided a consistently high quality service with excellent support when required
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dotdigital?
CRM Integration
Quality Support
Easy and evolving Interface

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
No way to save username or password
Cannot amend emails once sent - would be nice to be able to switch out images or update product info

Recommendations to others considering Dotdigital:
It is a robust system but as with most mailing solutions once you hit send there is no going back! The CRM integration is good but the connector can sometimes need a kick from support to synchronise. All in all a good, robust mailing solution.

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
We use the system to communicate regularly on a B2B basis with current and potential clients. We help our clients solve internal communication problems as well as solving some of our own.  An unexpected but fun use of the system is sending out invites to our Christmas party for example!

all_reviews.review_title: Does what it says on the tin!
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dotdigital?
This is an out of the box system that can be picked up easily by any marketer. You don't need huge amounts of creative skill to get started and the technical team are always been helpful if you get stuck. I've used this system with a number of companies and theintroduction of the 'Easy Editor' makes campaigns simple. What I love best is the campaign analysis. Clear simple and exportable. We use Salesforce and the sync facility is brilliant, giving us a great way for salespeople to understand where business originates, and for us a fighting chance as a b2b organisation to identify and calculate ROMI.

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
We've struggled to integrate the 'sign up to newsletter' function within our Wordpress CMS on the UKDN Waterflow website with the Dotmailer site. Other than that the system is about right for a company of our size

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
Integration of platforms. The feed into your CRM system is a must and this package delivers. The analysis allows us to prioritise hot leads and follow ups, and pass them to the right salespeople. And this is helping to justofy spend and calculate ROMI, both really important to any marketing manager.

all_reviews.review_title: Easy to use. Always improving. Helpful & friendly.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dotdigital?
The easy editor does exactly as described.  Any difficulties i have encountered have always been dealt with by support teams & accounts managers swiftly.  There is a definite sense that the staff enjoy what they do and want to work with you to get the best out of their products.

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
Haven't really found anything to be a problem with the service.  Perhaps clearer guides & examples on how different sub-products can be used (micro-sites, surveys, landing pages etc).

Recommendations to others considering Dotdigital:
I would recommend dotMailer if you have a large database of emails as they charge on the amount you send per month rather than the size of your database like other providers. Their support is great and i've found they really go out of their way to work with you.

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
Using the service enables us to offer a responsive notification service for new clients and since we started using dotMailer over 5 years ago it has become an invaluable source of revenue for us.

all_reviews.review_title: A dependable acquisition tool with huge (and intuitive) insight options
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dotdigital?
What I like best about dotMailer is that it just works - like 100%. It takes the most up-to-date knowledge in the sector and incorporates it in to a simple, intuitive platform that makes targeted digital marketing something anybody can do. If only all my marketing tools were this reliable.

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
I've been using dotMailer for over 5 years and I can honestly say that there isn't anything I dislike about it.

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
My key issue is how best to open up two-way communication with a number of vastly different target audiences. Sometimes I need a dialog, sometimes it's a call-to-action, sometimes it's pure data acquisition. dotMailer allows me to juggle each of these through very flexible dynamic content engineering, and a highly creative, data-driven, approach to segmenting audiences. Everything you do in dotMailer is live too, so not only can you download reports instantly, but you can actually tailor campaigns to send only the most popular version of the campaign mid-send.

If only all my marketing tools were this reliable.

Everything you do in dotMailer is live too, so not only can you download reports instantly, but you can actually tailor campaigns to send only the most popular version of the campaign mid-send.

all_reviews.review_title: Simple and Easy to use whilst staying cost effective
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dotdigital?
Dotmailer is so easy to use, a newb like me can create professional looking campaigns without breaking a sweat. Whenever I find something isn't working or I can't quite get something how I want, the support team is always ready to help and always manage to fix the issues!

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
Apart from a few features I feel they should add there's not a lot you can dislike because with dotmailer, you get what you came for, cheap and easy E-shot campaigns.

Recommendations to others considering Dotdigital:
I certainly recommend dotMailer if you're looking to save money

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
Before using Dotmailer I had to hire someone to create our E-Shots, now it's all done internally it's saved us money and time.

all_reviews.review_title: Outstanding customer service
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dotdigital?
The DotMailer platform takes all the effort out of sending e-mail campaigns yourself, they look after the formatting and reporting with the user just adding the copy.  The reporting tool is fantastic, giving clear reports of who's read, who's not, what's working and what's not.

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
Little to dislike about the company and their platform, only thing I might point my finger to is their account screens if you are not paying by DD they can be a little slow to update with your payment showing as received.

Recommendations to others considering Dotdigital:
All the staff we have spoken to at DotMailer have been amazing, ask them anything when you are setting up your account (no matter how silly it may seem) and they will have an answer, or find someone that does.

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
We are now able to communicate with our intermediaries without the need for a designer or programmer to get involved, sending updates to our teams has become a one man operation and the reports that are generated allow us to see what's of interest and what is not.

all_reviews.review_title: Easy to use but still has all the tools you need to create a great email campaign.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dotdigital?
As the Marketing Coordinator at DRD, dotMailer has made my life so much easier when it comes to sending out email campaigns to our customer base, and also to prospective customers.  The drag and drop feature makes it very very easy to create professional looking emails but without taking up too much time.  There is also a large range of pre-deigned templates which means I don't need to rely on a design company build me HTML templates any more.  My account manager Marcus Henley is always there to help -  he is a pleasure to work with and knows the company very well allowing him to sort out any problems I have very quickly.

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
Sometimes i get frustrated when i cant make a email look as good as their pre-designed templates.  I have been on some Photoshop courses which make it alot easier to create good looking images which help improve the overall look of a campaign.

Recommendations to others considering Dotdigital:
It would be great if you could embed YouTube videos using the code you can take from YouTube.

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
It is now a lot easier to target potential customers.  It doesn't take too long to create email shots and send them out which means they are now being sent a lot more often and the results have been great.  Not having to rely on others makes such a difference to a company.

all_reviews.review_title: Fantastic stand alone Email system
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dotdigital?
The easy editor is my favourite part of Dotmailer. You can create a template that is entirely inline with your own branding. You then have so much freedom when it comes to the layout of the email, from choosing text, to adding images, to changing coloured backgrounds, creating columns, adding links and so much more! You can upload your contact lists to dotmailer which allows you to manage all of your data effectively; you can filter the data in so many different ways that it enables you to create really targeted emails. I havent really explored the automated side of Dotmailer but i am really excited about what we could potentially achieve. In addition the packages are good value for money.

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
Dotmailer isn't our only system, we have had to integrate it into Microsoft Dynamics CRM. Whilst there is a good connector in place, it is noticeable that the two systems weren't designed for each other. This is why we haven't explored the automation side of Dotmailer as i'm not sure how it would work when using the two systems together. However, if you are using dotmailer on it's own i do not have any gripes with it at all, in fact i have recommended Dotmailer to another company (who would not need any integration into other systems).

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
Using Dotmailer we can create professional looking emails in a short space of time. We can segment data and create really targeted email campaigns. We have also created forms for our website that link directly back to a Dotmailer address book- i thought this functionality was particually useful.

all_reviews.review_title: I am an extremely happy user of DotMailer's services
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dotdigital?
The drag and drop WYSIWIG (What You See Is What You Get) nature of the e-mail creation/editing software means that anyone can use it, and no computer programming or HTML knowledge is necessary at all. You can test send as many times as you like and see what it looks like in your inbox (or those of your colleagues) for free, and even pay just PS5 to see it in dozens of different e-mail service providers.

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
The microsite editor is a clunky old fashioned editor. It works, and is relatively easy to use, but is nothing like as easy as the e-mail editor.

Recommendations to others considering Dotdigital:
I would definitely recommend this to anyone sending e-mails to their customers or prospective customers.

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
We have saved thousands of pounds compared to using an agency. We now do it all ourselves.

I have worked in e-marketing for many years and as a result have had the 'pleasure' of using a variety of e-mail marketing software but I will always recommend dotMailer to any new company I join. The easy-editor tool makes creating emails so simple and the user experience/interface makes life so much easier compared to other tools I have used in the past.

I sometimes experience problems with formatting, but that is probably more a case of user error than dotMailers functionality.

all_reviews.review_title: dotMailer is a fantastic tool
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dotdigital?
I have personally worked on dotmailer and a few other email marketing tools available and have to say that this is one of the best that is available. The simple interface, easy to use tools, drag and drop feature, highly customizable elements, easy access to high quality analytics and reporting tools makes dotMailer one of the best tools for email marketing. Initially, it took me a couple of hours to design the first few email campaigns. But once, i got familiar with the interface (which was around the third or fourth email campaign), it took me nothing more than 20 minutes to design a campaign from scratch! The default campaign flow is designed to make work easy for marketers and saves a lot of time. Plus, the dotMailer support team and the community has almost all the answers you need if you get stuck on any aspect. Its easy to import leads or contacts into the database (of course, it has it's own watchdog), segment the database and run an email campaign.

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
While using the template feature, the images you upload tend to pixalate. Hence if you want to use an image as the banner for any email campaign, make sure that it fits into the template options and that file size is not too less.

Recommendations to others considering Dotdigital:
I would highly recommend this email marketing tool, since it is among the cheaper ones available in the market and which is efficient as well. you might want to consider other tools like Marketo or MailChimp, but if on a tight budget, then this is a good option.

reviewer.reviewer_job_title: Competitive Intelligence & Marketing Ops Leader (Global Marketing) - Leica Biosystems

all_reviews.review_title: Very decent for smaller organisations without a big budget for email software
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dotdigital?
Creating a campaign, uploading a list and sending an email is what Dotmailer is good at - in fact, in my experience it's better than anyone for that in terms of ease-of-use.  Their WYSIWYG editor is as good as Mailchimp's as well, although it's not something I've used much as my company had dedicated design and coding resource for email.

In general, the software is very easy to use and is absolutely perfect for small businesses just starting out in email marketing or who don't have very advanced requirements.  Their drag and drop segmentation tool, which was added a while ago is also very useful.

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
Account management is poor.  I've had 3 different account managers and all have been slow to respond to emails and hard to contact by phone.  Their general support line isn't great either.  Before I moved to another provider (Responsys, much more expensive!) Dotmailer had 2 major days of downtime which had a significant effect on my revenue.

Their API is also not designed for uploading large lists to, it's a nightmare to automate daily data transfers into although I appreciate this isn't their typical user.

What problems is Dotdigital solving and how is that benefiting you?
Dotmailer enabled us to send large volumes of email quickly and cheaply.

Creating a campaign, uploading a list and sending an email is what Dotmailer is good at - in fact, in my experience it's better than anyone for that in terms of ease-of-use.  Their WYSIWYG editor is as good as Mailchimp's as well, although it's not something I've used much as my company had dedicated design and coding resource for email.

In general, the software is very easy to use and is absolutely perfect for small businesses just starting out in email marketing or who don't have very advanced requirements.  Their drag and drop segmentation tool, which was added a while ago is also very useful.

Account management is poor.  I've had 3 different account managers and all have been slow to respond to emails and hard to contact by phone.  Their general support line isn't great either.  Before I moved to another provider (Responsys, much more expensive!) Dotmailer had 2 major days of downtime which had a significant effect on my revenue.

Their API is also not designed for uploading large lists to, it's a nightmare to automate daily data transfers into although I appreciate this isn't their typical user.

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
I cannot really fault the software or support I receive from my Business Support Manager - he is always on the end if the phone (and that can me multiple times a day). I would like more information on my competitors, legislation etc on a regular basis.

The subject line testing tool is great, we can test a couple of different emails and check how well it does before we send it out. Service has been consistent.

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?

Using dotMailer has saved us a lot of time and money. It has cut down our email building and execution time by half by sending emails to large lists very quickly and easily.  Anyone can use it and you don't need to be tech savvy to use the platform.

all_reviews.review_title: Straightforward easy to use professional email marketing software with very good analytics
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dotdigital?
I really liked the wide choice of email templates, the A/B email subject name testing with the dotMailer software.  It is a very user friendly software. dotMailer really built the software around the user and not forced the user to work around the software. The training session at their office in Croydon, England was informative and succinct. I liked the clear and honest way that the account manager dealt with all my queries. The fact that dotMailer have an office in the UK was great too as it meant I could talk directly on the phone to my account manager. Their user manual was also very comprehensive as well as reports on email marketing by companies.

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
To be honest, dotMailer totally suited the purposes that I set for which was to drive staff traffic to the organisation's intranet and internet sites. I was content marketing to an internal audience of over a thousand and it suited very well.

Recommendations to others considering Dotdigital:
Pay for the training session, work through the manual and practice sending out some emails before using the software. Get recommendation of a good account manager. The best account managers are available, returns calls, knowledgeable, patient, honest and friendly.

The training session at their office in Croydon, England was informative and succinct. I liked the clear and honest way that the account manager dealt with all my queries. The fact that dotMailer have an office in the UK was great too as it meant I could talk directly on the phone to my account manager. Their user manual was also very comprehensive as well as reports on email marketing by companies.

review_question_answers.question: What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
review_question_answers.answer: To be honest, dotMailer totally suited the purposes that I set for which was to drive staff traffic to the organisation's intranet and internet sites. I was content marketing to an internal audience of over a thousand and it suited very well.

review_question_answers.question: Recommendations to others considering Dotdigital:
review_question_answers.answer: Pay for the training session, work through the manual and practice sending out some emails before using the software. Get recommendation of a good account manager. The best account managers are available, returns calls, knowledgeable, patient, honest and friendly.

This is a real shame as their products are actually very good!

all_reviews.review_title: Great mailing system with some brilliant analytics
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Dotdigital?
Unlike other email marketing platforms dotMailer take pride that their top priority is email deliver-ability. Every-time you upload a mailing list the email addresses are analysed and you sometimes have to prove where the emails came from. This allows them to block customers that break EU direct marketing rules as well as making that your emails get delivered.
I LOVE the country heatmap. Being able to see where your emails are being opened and then drawing a box around a country of state and just marketing to those people. Brilliant! They also have a whole host of other great analytics as well as subject line testing so that you can pick the subject that has the greatest open rates. Just inspired.

What do you dislike about Dotdigital?
Yup to very recently integration was an issue but this has been mostly resolved. They do generally cost a bit more than other providers but the deliver-ability and analytics make this a no-brainer.

Recommendations to others considering Dotdigital:
They do deals to get 50% of the sign up fee or sometimes even more, bargain with them! :)

review_question_answers.answer:

Every-time you upload a mailing list the email addresses are analysed and you sometimes have to prove where the emails came from. This allows them to block customers that break EU direct marketing rules as well as making that your emails get delivered.
I LOVE the country heatmap. Being able to see where your emails are being opened and then drawing a box around a country of state and just marketing to those people. Brilliant! They also have a whole host of other great analytics as well as subject line testing so that you can pick the subject that has the greatest open rates. Just inspired.

review_question_answers.answer: Yup to very recently integration was an issue but this has been mostly resolved. They do generally cost a bit more than other providers but the deliver-ability and analytics make this a no-brainer.
